Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 3”
Reviews.Author: Mav98
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd better get round to putting our review up from last year... Email them first & they will tell you which apt you are being put in, this will make it easier for the taxi to find the right hotel. We were in 3 so can only comment on this one. Rooms were cleaned daily & as advertised in the book,reception spoke very good English & were helpful when asked a question. Take an ethernet cable if you are taking a laptop, reception will provide one but they tend to be quite short. Breakfasts were fine with lots of choice & nice coffee/tea, we were usually early & it wasn't busy at this time can't comment on how busy it gets later in the morning. Using the pool involves timing it with the sun, it tends to get quite a bit of shade from other hotels, as in most things it's all about timing. Make sure the aircon works OK because you will need it at night,any problems report it straight away to reception. Don't use the taxi outside the hotel, they are nicer cars but you pay a premium. The many taxis that drive up & down the streets are OK & cheaper. The metro is the way to go in getting around Dubai, the main station is in the centre of a junction probably a mile away,this can seem a lot further in the heat of the day :-) The nearest stop is quite near to the hotel,straight opposite reception up the side streets & you will come to the main drag,to the right you will see the station above the road, it looks very futuristic. I would start off with the main station where you get your travel card which you can top up as you use it. Using the Metro will get you to the malls very quickly & in aircon too.The Dubai Mall will involve a short bus journey from the terminal to the mall, same card can be used on this trip too. This mall also has the entrance to the Burj Khalifa. Do go see the fountains at the bottom of the Khalifa at night. Overall a very good trip,well it was our honeymoon... Keith.

Reviews.Title: “fit for purpose hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandipchak
Reviews.Content: i stayed at GS5. there are about 10 buildings and even experienced taxi drivers get confused which is which. on the google map it does not show the exact place. there is free wifi in the lobby and in the rrom, you have to ask for the cable which they promptly supplied and free internet access was available. rooms are quite large even for a family (i was on my own). tea coffee making facility and microwave and cutlery are provided. large king size bed and neat covers. changed daily. quiet surroundings and ensures quality sleep. for me breakfast was not included so cannot comment, i ate outside. the hotel is tucked in from the main busy streets. quite good budget hotel for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Short but nice”
Reviews.Author: Albert Maxime A
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay in golden sands 5 i stayed in the studio. Arrived there in the late afternoon coming in from the outside you wouldn't think much of the place but its a quite place friendly staff very caring, check-in went smoothly. Getting in my room just by opening the door i could tell that i was going to have a nice stay. Clean room kitchen at the entrance nice big bed but a bit hard clean bathroom. The whole hotel has free high speed internet which is a plus for me. I didn't get a chance to try the in room service nor the in-house restaurant. Outside not far on the right hand side there's a little groceries store like 20 meters away. You get complementary water and tea/coffee. All in all a very nice place and it surpassed my expectation and will definitely stay longer next time i'm in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “ideal apartments.near shops and beach”
Reviews.Author: dehair0
Reviews.Content: have stopped at g sands 3 and 5 now 9.all excellent with small pools and snack resteraunts.close to shopping arcades malls and near the creek if you like a 15 min walk. rooms clean and well maintained.g sands 9 are huge

Reviews.Title: “Time to refurbish!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: clarisiza
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in a studio room in block 3. Location is ok not far from a big supermarket (Spinneys, open 24hrs) & metro station (very clean & since it is over ground you can actually have a great view of the city while travelling). Staff was just ok, sometimes a bit overbearing: as soon as you stepped foot outside the hotel they kept asking you if you needed help even if you were perfectly fine, but when you actually needed their help it was a different story: I had to call a few times for different things broken in our room and never got fixed! The room itself was just ok, not luxurious but not bad either, the 2 major problems were the bathroom being very old& very dirty (it should be changed completely) and the fact that cleanliness was not their major strength. Reading through the reviews on this site I understood that the cheapest taxi were the yellow ones so I was looking for them, the way it works is that all taxi are creamy colour, the only difference is the roof, the yellow taxi are the national ones. If you catch a taxi from the airport the price starts from 20aed, while if you stop it on the street it’s only 4. So we paid 50aed from the airport to the hotel and only 23 from the hotel to the airport. During the day both subway & buses are very convenient, cheap and clean so after buying a metro card (which you can use both on trains & buses) we used it for our entire stay. I would stay in this hotel again only if the price was very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “GS10 - really convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Spacecrew
Reviews.Content: On first looks this hotel seems a bit basic and tired. However, the service is friendly and the daily cleaning service was impeccable. There were plenty of taxis to be found to hail outside (all with meters) or the nearest metro station was only 5 minutes away and super clean. The location opposite the Spinney's supermarket mall was a real bonus and the foreign exchange shop there had much better than than the hotel. We didn't know we could have gone to the other Golden Sands buildings to use their pool. Would have been handy to know as the one at GS10 was in shadows most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxed and pleasant atmosphere in a great location if you don't mind being a fair bit away from beach”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel/apartment in May 2011. Staff were helpful and courteous. Kitchenette was stocked with all you need for basic cooking requirements. The apartment was serviced daily to a high standard of cleanliness. I stayed in Golden sands 5 with a roof top pool. The pool area was really quiet. The Golden Sands is set across many streets in blocks of 10 in total. Make sure you know which number you are booked into. Some blocks don't have a pool so I would recommend number 5 as this has a roof top pool. There is a Spinney supermarket located on both main roads to east and west of the block. Everything is available except alcohol. If you are a Brit who can't live without your bacon this is also available at Spinney.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 3”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellerman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this apartment complex in early February 2012 for 7 nights. I arrived early due to flight timings so was asked to wait in the foyer until my room was available (3 hours or so) but the staff were happy to secure my luggage until the room was free and so I decided to go take a walk to the nearby shop to get some things in for the room (bread, milk etc). On returning 20 minutes later I found my luggage still beside the reception desk but with a label on it with my name - not the security I was expecting! I actually got my room after only another hour of waiting and still before the normal 2pm time so that was good. The room was very spacious and had a huge bed. There was a shower, not bath, and the kitchenette area was well designed with adequate worktop space for food preparation. There was sufficient pots, pans, crockery and utensils available for 4 people. In addition there was a microwave, fridge, electric hob and a washer/dryer. The in-room safe was large enough for a laptop to be secured. Wired internet (free) is available and is surprisingly fast and far better than I have found in other hotels in Dubai. The TV shows some English language channels including BBC World news and Fox Movies. I took a tour of the building facilities to see if it matched the brochure. There is a small pool which is next to a restaurant and the gym. All 3 are on the 1st floor with the pool being outside on a sun terrace. There are 7 floors in total which does affect the amount of hours the sun can reach that area but even in February it was fine from about 9am - 3pm. The gym is well stocked with modern machinery including 3 treadmills, 2 rowers, a bike, plenty of loose weights and a couple of weight machines. There is plenty of water available but you will need to take your own towel. The restaurant serves breakfast, a daily BBQ by the pool, and an evening all-you-can-eat buffet from 6:30pm - 10pm (AED 69 pp) The only complaint I have for the room is that the dryer function of the washing machine did not work and when I complained to the Housekeeping they sent an engineer to my room who twiddled some knobs, pushed some buttons, opened and closed the door and declared it perfectly serviceable. I disagreed as I had run 3 cycles and I still had wet clothes in there. He went away and came back 15 minutes later with a replacement machine. This impressed me until a fellow guest at the hotel came along to my room and asked the mechanic where his washing machine had gone from his room (next door!). End result was I got my clothes dried eventually and my neighbour got a new machine and a bowl of fruit. Overall, the Golden Sands 3 was a perfectly adequate apartment with daily room cleaning and towel exchange. Facilities are good, if slightly dated in places, but still good value. The location is very handy for the shops, restaurants, and entertainment with a decent sized supermarket (Spinney's) within a 5 minute walk and 3 English-themed sports bars within 10 minutes. The Metro is also 5 minutes walk to get you to the main Malls. Be aware that there are Golden Sands 1 - 10 and this review is only for Golden Sands 3. I have also stayed at Golden Sands 5 during this trip and a separate review is available for that. I'm writing this review in my room at GS 5 and will save you the trouble by saying already that GS 3 rooms are better than GS 5 but not by much. Both buildings share the same pool/restaurant/gym facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for us.”
Reviews.Author: RicohWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 10 days in Dubai stopping at GS 5. We found the hotel appartment ideal for what we wanted. It was clean, the staff were friendly polite and efficient, and it was close and convenient enough to all the local amenities. Our room was spacious and came equipped with cooking and washing facilities, as well as all the standard stuff. Towels and tea and coffee were replenished daily, and the room cleaned also on a daily basis. We ate twice at the hotel (the restaurant is lovely and airy) and found the food very respectable (lamb chops, chips and extras about £8). We got the room for a good price, although the advertised rates at the hotel were much higher. All in all a good experience and would definately reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 10 is great for families”
Reviews.Author: Jacob57
Reviews.Content: We went 5 families to Dubai and found that 4 apartments in Golden Sands 10 (2 bedroom apartments) was suitable for us. First one must understand that Golden Sands is a group of individual buildings, each offering separate services. The only co-operation is that if you stay in one, you may use the facilities of the others (like indoor pool in one, rooftop pool in another, gym, wi-fi, etc.) Golden Sands no. 10 is located on the southern edge of the area, close to a 24x7 supermarket, and with a pool in the centre of a building creating a square around it. Apartments either give on the pool or the street, most (but not all) have balcony (large ones) and are both spacious, clean and reasonably equipped with furniture. Kitchenware is just enough to get you through the day, but only just. You should either bring your own bread knife of buy the cheapest one in the supermarket (18 AED). There is internet by cable in all rooms, only wi-fi close to the reception. There is also a coffee shop but none of us used it, having the cheap supermarket nearby. There is a desk for car rental and easy access to a tour desk in Golden Sands no. 3. Staff is friendly and helpful, making sure that you get all the information and understand it. Also they can arrange for taxis or limo's, also for a day tour (we paid 600 AED for 11 hours in a 4x4 that took 7 persons, wnet to Abu Dhabi with us and were very helpful). Metro and a large shopping mall is within 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Price have now shot up by £600 since last year”
Reviews.Author: needy s
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel apartments at GS 10. They werent plush but for the price (then) it was a good deal and has the facilities we needed. However now looking at their prices..they have shot up and not worth it. They are a 3 star hotel. Reservations arent helpful> you can email then many times and they wont get back to you unless you call. We stayed last year for a month..this year the price has shot up by £600 pre easter! Rubbish conceirge. I had a pram and shopping they never helped me up the stairs to the reception area of the hotel and dont get you a taxi if you need one. Only time they helped was when I was leaving to take the baggage to a cab I flagged down..I assume to get tip

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: jane_son
Reviews.Content: We went on the 25th December 2011 for 7 nights, having read many reviews here we were a little concerned, but I have to say it was fantastic, the apartment we were given was in block 10 opposite Spinnys a local supermarket where you could get freshly baked bread in the mornings. The staff were fab, they were helpfully and friendly. We booked our safari experience through Golden Sands too, and had a ball. I cannot recommend this hotel any more, housekeeping was every day, rooms were spacious, kitchen was fully equipped there was a balcony where we enjoyed our evenings, although there was a pool we had no time to use it, taxis available outside anytime, local restaurants were lovely, there was pizza, KFC and many more places to eat all walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: norwegiandanish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands 5, for 5 nights. The rooms are old, and you could easily see that they have not been renovated for a long time. The rooms where clean. I like the size of the rooms, but could have wanted a softer bed. The bed was hard, and so was the pillows. Loved that it had a small kitchen, but I did only use the fridge. We had the breakfast inkluded, but only used it one morning. Both me and my daughter think it was not that much to choose from. And the breakfast restaurant was so crowded, and I could not leave my table to get more to drink without anybody taking my table. After that experience, we decided to go to the supermaket to get breakfast. My daughter thinks it was a bit far to walk to the metro station. But for families without kids, the 15 min. walk is no problem. It is about 10-15 min. walk from Burj juman center, where you have different restaurants. There are two pool areas, one next to the restaurant. It is very small, and a lot of pigeons poo around it, so not that pleasant. We used the pool on the rooftop, it was big and had a lifeguard that was looking over it (almost all the time). My daughter loved the pool, and I had problems getting here up. The downside on the pool, was that the tiles/floor around it, where the sunbeds where, was dirty. So when you got up of the pool, and walked to your sunbed, your feets where black underneath. There where not enough sunbeds, to all of the persons wanting to use them. So if we wanted a sunbed we had to go up early to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, average service - central location.”
Reviews.Author: alifiyan
Reviews.Content: We had booked Golden Sands 3 for a month, as we were travelling with kids and wanted the en-suite kitchen facility. The one bedroom room offers you a private bedroom with an attached bath and an additional two beds, and one sofa - bed, along with a mini kitchen and separate bath. Though the kitchen can probably be best used for breakfast only, as it is not fully equipped. The rooms are not the cleanest and the service is very slow. The location, although central,is a fifteen minute walk to the train station though taxis are available easily. It also has close access to 2 different grocery stores and a pharmacy and a supermarket. A fifteen minute walk will take you to a range of different cuisine restaurants with a delivery facility. Okay for a short trip without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - good long term Dubai base”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBBad
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Dubai for a significant length of time but not long enough to justify renting a place for 12 months the Golden Sands is a solid option. If you don't like to look after yourself don't go - it is NOT a hotel and is not really geared up to be one although they will do your laundry if you can't (there is a washer/dryer in the room) and there is a "cafe" The following review applies to GS 3 - I haven't stayed at GS 10 for a while so will review that if/when I next stay there but a few years ago it was of a much higher quality in terms of rooms - all other comments still apply. It is clean and good value and gives you some independence. I would NOT use this place as a hotel for a few days but when in town for 2-3 weeks it makes total sense since being in the same hotel for that length of time can drive you round the bend. A bit spartan but that is reflected in the price. If you are a drinker make sure you raid Duty Free on the way in! Positives - it's clean and good value, near a big Spinneys (and a couple of smaller supermarkets) and Bargeman Mall, the internet (wired in room) is both excellent quality - better than the Interconti and 4 points - and free (well done Golden Sands - very refreshing), well equipped, good TVs with good channel choice, almost all taxi drivers know where it is Negatives - you are in Bur Dubai and it can be a pain to get a taxi, it is full of budget travellers, the service is average, there is no bar, restaurant or room service, it can be a bit noisy at times since doors are made of cardboard apparently, they will tuck you up with a dodgy room if they can so be robust when checking in, immediate area is pretty bleak. NOT a good place for a family unless you are on a serious budget since pool is very average and it's nowhere near beaches or much else to do but fine for business and/or solo or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money! GS-5”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Rosh
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Dubai and I must admit I was not expecting too much especially when I let my office take care of the bookings. The room as good, very comfortable. They had a mini kitchen, nice big refrigerator, steam iron, hair dryer etc. Good room service, the breakfast buffet was also nice. The in room menu is also quite affordable. The place is a complete value for money. I'd strongly suggest you to consider staying in this place if you're looking for a comfortable stay for a while in Bur Dubai. The only thing - try getting Golden Sands - 9 it's close to Al Karama metro. If you're in GS-5, you're in one of those places where its close enough for you to consider to not take a cab, yet far enough that you'll not be able to walk it up. Good food is not too far away incase you're bored to cook and the staff is also quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel apartments, don't expect much wonders”
Reviews.Author: DrVG
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife in january 2012. Rooms are ok, no bath tub, basic ammenities, like service apartments with refrigerator, cooking, microwave, washing machine etc. Staff is courteous, breakfast is ok. Overall just value for money. But the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is composed of multiple buildings in the same neighborhood. Free parking, all sizes and layouts, fully furnished apartments. Good location in the Bur Dubai area, not very good if you plan to walk. Nothing special about this place, but nothing dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 10 - Overall very good.”
Reviews.Author: raunak182
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family for a week. Overall it is a very good place to stay. Rates are quite decent and the location is good. You can get Indian food at walking distance. Even Spinney's (departmental store) is very close. You can walk to the metro station (you might not use it though) The size of the rooms/hall are quite decent. Would recommend if you are planning to visit in large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 3: Not great”
Reviews.Author: Mitika M
Reviews.Content: I was greatly impressed with my stay at the Golden Sands 10, but GS 3 was very average. They only had one receptionist when I checked in and he was very frustrated because he had to handle the job by himself when the hotel was at full occupancy. I did order breakfast in once and it was good. I stayed here on the night of the 31st December and paid a hefty price for a regular room, and I didn't find half my money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Average Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: RRohatgi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here (Golden Sand 5) for 6 nights.... Location - The nearest Metro station is about 20 min walk, not suitable if you have small kids. Taxi will charge 10 AED. There is no Taxi Rank below hotel and hotel also do not call taxis. It is your luck - sometime you could get a taxi immediately, sometime you have to walk top main road to get a taxi. Rooms - are good but house keeping needs improvement. Once when I came back in the evening, there were no towels. I find overall an average accommodation, in contrast with some reviews.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: SeansTrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GS5 on Dec 25, 26 and 27. We loved it. The location is great for all things Bur Dubai- 10-minute walk to the nearest Metro (Al Fahidi). There is ample free parking. Extremely courteous and smiling front desk staff make checking in a pleasure. The rooms were great - we had adjoining studios - kids loved one of their own. Free Internet, well-supplied kitchen with cooker, fridge, etc. Very clean and spacious. Will definitely stay here again - in fact, looking forward to doing so - better than quite a few 5-star hotels I've stayed at in the UAE.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the golden sands 10 and 5 with a few friends on a trip to Dubai. The rooms were spacious and good value for money, rooms cleaned regualry. Only downside is there is no bar or decent restraunt there. I found Goodfellas bar in a nearby hotel Regal Plaza good. It's got a lot of TV's and had every premiership game on and the beer was good! Only the food there was nice. Goldensands also close to supermarket and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands, Dubai”
Reviews.Author: NiranjanaGurru
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with your family. It is in the city centre and very convenient for travelling to the attractions in Dubai. i faced no problems at all during my 3 days stay while in Dubai. The staff was very helpful too. Lovely rooms with very good ambiance. Excellent service and response from the staff. The apartment is close to the metro station hence traveling to any part of the city is easy and hassle free. If I ever visit Dubai again I will surely get back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fifty fifty”
Reviews.Author: life4journey
Reviews.Content: This place is ideal for a budget traveller- they give good service and have maintained the property as well as they possibly can. There are lots of towers constructed, almost overlapping each other, the place is in the middle of lots of other apartments and hotels, as a result there cannot be any view from any of the rooms. In short, the rooms, lobby, reception - nothing has a luxurious feel to it. Its just a nice clean place to spend 5 - 6 hours of the night and spend the rest of the time in the nearby markets, malls or just gng out for the adventures, dubai has to offer! The breakfast is repetitive and average. Most of the staff is indian ...so you kinda feel at home, if you are an indian!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Accomodation in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: GurruChennai
Reviews.Content: I would rate this as a Good value for money . I went along with my wife , kid and family members . 4 people stayed in a Appartment for AED 320 / night . we felt good with the place . It got iron box , 2 Wash rooms , seperate room for the couples . Nearby i had Saravanabavan from where i got home delivery foods

Reviews.Title: “Economical And worth a Luxury stay”
Reviews.Author: ishan1988
Reviews.Content: Golden Sands 10 Hotel Apartments are very clean and well maintained apartments. Its worth spending money on it if you are looking for a decent economical stay with luxury. Golden sands staff is very welcoming and co-operative and i had a very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nyles02
Reviews.Content: We eventually arrived at Golden Sands 5 for a 2 night stay. It took us a little while to locate the apartment block. The staff were friendly enough and we were upgraded to an executive suite for a small fee. The room while spacious and clean was standard. No luxury but the room standard is reflected in the price.The bathroom has a shower and we found it a little gloomy and in need of an upgrade. The apartment is located in an area consisting of several apartment blocks amongst a few hotels. It was a pleasant stay overall, but if you are looking for luxury this is not the place to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands Apartment Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: Rizwan P
Reviews.Content: We checked in during November 2011. We were asked for 300 Dirham deposit upon arrival although we had paid the agent in uK in full. Having no dirhams we paid the deposit in £ but was told they will refund us in dirhams. Outside the hotel the exchange rates was £=5.77 but the refund was equivalent to 5.45 we felt a bit of penny pinching from the hotel they could have return the same sterling back. The restaurant staff need to be a bit more customer care oriented, morning breakfast was busy and there waas no place, a waiter said this place is full instead of trying to locate empty place to share with a table.it a good american lady to spot us and invite us to her table and ask us to join her.

Reviews.Title: “GS - 10: Good....very decent”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay_Jain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at GS 10 in first week Nov 11 with family - including my mom, wife and son aged 7 years. We booked a 2BR apartment for 8 days and paid AED 4,545 for 8N (no breakfast) - which I think was very good value. The property shows some signs of ageing, but is kept very clean - much better than my home! The best thing about the apartment was having Spinneys just across the road - this took care of our daily groceries. The apartment has everything that one may need - a refrigerator, cooking system, microwave, washingmachine, television, utensils etc. They have three PCs for free use by guests - all connected with internet. Breakfast was AED 50pp. As mentioned by previous reviewers, I didnt enconter any cold behaviour from the reception -infact they were warm and helpful to the umpteen questions we asked them. Infact, when I asked one of the guys on the desk on where I could buy good dates, he gave me a 3.5kg box of dates that he had recd as gift - saying he was alone in Dubai and this is a gift to a brother - so sweet of him - I tried to give him money for the same, but he wouldnt take it. So, I left my Entertainer's books with them, lest they might use it. Taxis are available in abundance. Airport transfers are about AED 20-25 one way.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: Xango82
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Golden Sands 5 was ok. I arrived very early in the morning and when I went to check in they told me that no rooms were available. They were nice enough to allow me to do an early check in after catching some ZZZ’s in the lobby. When I got to my room it was not very clean. I chalked it up to they were in a rush to get me in the room so I didn’t mind it too much, I just called and asked them to send someone to come up and sweep and mop and change the shower curtain because it smelled like urine. The location is good. It’s not too too far from the Al Karama Metro Station. It’s not close to the airport or to any of the major malls but you can just take a taxi or the Metro. The staff were friendly, especially the night staff. There are a few mini-marts and grocery stores close by so you can go and buy good to cook or pick up some snacks. There are 9 different buildings that make up the Golden Sands. The restaurant was not too bad and it was nice and relaxing at the little pool they had. There was free WiFi in the lobby and wired internet in the rooms. Free internet in hotels in Dubai is a little hard to come by so I really enjoyed that. Over all the experience was average. It is not that bad a place to stay in for 3 or 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Will never repeat this experience”
Reviews.Author: Adi_Talati
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Sands 5 Hotel Apartments in November for 2 weeks while i was in Dubai for business. The only reason we picked this one was the proximity to our place of work, Bur Dubai, however that ended up being the only good point about this Hotel - its location. The experience at the reception was poor - as the reception staff could not get their card authorization machines working. And the worst part of the welcome experience was that key card given to me was not working. The key card not working immediately after check in is a bad impression which sticks like super glue The rooms were small as per Dubai standards. The corridor that led to my room had a foul smell - which didn't leave till I checked out. The only 2 merits of my stay at Golden Sands 5, was the quick speed of the internet, and the swimming pool on the top floor - which was didn’t have any other swimmers. Now for the complaints: Room service i felt was definitely not value for money. Laundry bags and list were not replenished for at least 3 days Laundry took 48 hours to come in No change of the soaps / toiletries for at least a week till I requested Limited channels on TV - none of which hit the spot! All in all an experience to forget

Reviews.Title: “Don't mess with reception!”
Reviews.Author: AndreasTs
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated so bad in any hotel anywhere in the world like at this place. One can stand at reception and not even book a room, but will be asked to use the computer in the business center to make a reservation. Once this is done and back to the counter, you can be sure that everything with your reservation will be messed up. My first check in took 2 hours, that of my friend was performed in a record time of 45 min. By the time this was done, it was 4 AM in the morning, but we still had to pay the full price. Everything and all is the guest fault. So don't ask questions or they let you know who has the power to put you in the worst and noisiest room available. Take some water and a sandwich with you while checking in instead and keep smiling.The people at reception are totally incapable but try cover it well with the nastiest arrogance. Would be a good value hotel, without the duty managers and people at reception, coupled with the messiest booking service ever. Rooms are good value for money and large size. All is there from washing machine to small kitchen. House cleaning staff are excellent and friendly. Perhaps the hotel could promote them to reception. That could make me consider to come back. Otherwise, no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “good val for dubai”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBazz
Reviews.Content: got this hotle going to goa, from dubai booking office in dubai airport,,,good rooms some frige tv ect,, good rest,,food good had a buffet dinner,beef ,chicken, soup ect,at 12 pound each ,good price for dubai,, would go back,,

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Family short breaks to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-reviews-byMT
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Golden sands a number of times in the past. It provides with hotel apartments where you have spacious rooms with all the hotel type facilities such as daily cleaning and breakfast. Also has swimming pool. Good amenities and centrally located in Bur Dubai. It also provides with self catering facilities. Do not expect the 5 star hotel services as these as apartments but ideal for families visiting Dubai for short stay or visiting Dubai for first time.

Reviews.Title: “Potential is there to be better”
Reviews.Author: julz4
Reviews.Content: I booked the golden sands 3 hotel as a package through e-bookers and expected it to be alot better than it was portrayed. I read many reviews on this site, but decided to ignore the more negative comments. First huge negative is the fact that although they knew I was arriving very early as did many other travelers my room would not be ready until 12pm at the earliest.My husband and I did have a wander round the block and into a nearby shop but after such a long flight we were just to tired.We sat in the hotel lobby for hours and not once did anyone say anything to us. We were allowed to go upstairs to the coffee shop which was fine but we were quickly told and rather abruptly that we would happy to pay for our cup of coffee.Eventually we were given our key card and shown to our room.On first impression it looked OK and I use the term loosely.We started to have a look around and it was the bathroom that got me the most, it was filthy with impregnated grime. The tiles had never seen a cleaner or bleach before, infact I used a few of my face wipes to clean some of the tiles which were black with mildew. There was a metal soap dish attached by 1 screw in the shower.The whole bathroom looked thrown together and about 20 years old and just left to rot. The kitchen area wasn't great but served its purpose.If you intend to buy food and do some sort of cooking then make sure you bring some dishcloths and a tea towel as you are not provided with any.You do have a washing machine,microwave,kettle and a 2 ring stove, sadly no toaster which i missed as the bread here is lovely.For some reason you are only given 3 of everything, except we only had 1 glass and one of our saucers had been glued together. On reading other reviews about stealing and prostitution and cant say I had that problem. The area is perfectly safe and had no problem with leering and unfriendly people. We never ate in the hotel so cant comment on the food, however we did eat at the 4 points just round the corner on the street running parallel, it has 3 restaurants but we only ate at yesterday pub, where we also watched F1 on the big screen.Fabulous mixed grill and burgers. Buy your coffee,milk etc at spinneys just up the road,very reasonably priced and they sell pork. Taxis are easily flagged down on the street(cheaper than the hotel taxi)20dhs to dubai mall,40dhs to emirates mall.Buy a all zone metro card,17dhs(under£3.00)lovely and smooth and clean. If you get a chance try a trip to Hatta to the hotel there it was lovely and peaceful and the drive through the desert and mountains makes a nice change to buildings,also see the camels roaming around.(Take your passport as you pass into oman territory for a few miles) All in all this has been a good trip and I certainly haven't let the poor standards of the hotel let it spoil it. If need a budget place to just lay your head then this will be ok Will be back to visit dubai as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “Old, well used hotel not 3*”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOdriscoll
Reviews.Content: Everything in the apartment is so old and very well used from the shower to the sinks and taps. The blankets, bed covers, chairs feel filthy and look as if they have never been cleaned or washed. We would not recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, Golden Sands is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mohammed c
Reviews.Content: The location is in Bur Dubai, close to the Burjuman shopping centre and plenty of restaurants. the Room we had was a two bedroom apartment. It was clean, had 2 bathrooms (both en suite) aircon was fab (we needed it!). when we discovered the pool the kids did not want to go anywhere else. local supermarket (24/7 spinneys) means you are never far away from what you need. The lobby is nice with an authentic arabian corner! Exchange rate was fair, porters great and always service with a smile. highly recommended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Sunflowertilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and thought that it was good value for money and a great place to stay. It is basic but adequate. I would not recommend the breakfast but given that Spinneys is 2 mins walk away this is not really a problem. The beds were comfortable and clean. The cleaner came in daily and did a reasonable job. The carpets were badly stained and could do with being replaced. Taxis were easy to get from the doorstep (taxis in Dubai are very cheap). We used one hotel taxi but would not recommend as the trip cost twice as much as usual Dubai taxi. Great that could book Big Bus Tour from Golden Sands 3. Near Metro station. Appartments have a pool that was clean and great fun.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghoshi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in golden sands 3.. 2 weeks ago . its a 3 star hotel not 4 . Staff is friendly n helpfull. hotel is 10 min walk from d metro station n burjman mall. Beach is 10 min drive from hotel but always use dubai taxi coz hotel taxi is very expensive . n you can always find a taxi outside hotel . I went with my 5 yrs old son and i found it was quite safe to walk back to the hotel at night from the metro station or restaurants. But for children its not much to do in the hotel. overall its a gud hotel on gud location with gud value of money but you are after luxury this is not a best hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommend”
Reviews.Author: francis l
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Golden Sands hotel and I found the staff was incompetent and not open-minded. The sheets of my bed was not clean. The breakfast provided was bland and tasteless, that look like dog food. I do not recommend this hotel. The neighborhood is not safe at night. a lot of perverts in search of their prey frequent the area and revolves around the hotel. The Downtown Dubai is located 30 light years away. Take a taxi every day back money. The rooms look directly in front of a building frequented by people not recommended. In short run.

Reviews.Title: “golden sands 3”
Reviews.Author: aqsCapeTown
Reviews.Content: i stayed at these apartments for 3 nights.the are a total of 11 golden sands blocks.all situated in bur dubai.the place is neat clean.apartment 404 had i bedroom ensuite old but clean.lounge and kitchen with stove fridge washing machine and microwave.iron and ironing board as well.dont use taxis provided by hotel ,lexus taxis they cost more.just go onto the street an hail a taxi.gs 3 is situated far from the main roads if u wanted to use bus or train its a long walk.people in dubai generally will say small walk, but i found it to be far in the searing heat.there is a pool and gym as well.breakfast was good.i personally would recommend gs 1or 2 as they are the closest to main road.there is only 1 shop near to the apartment, that is opened 24 hrs at back of hotel it sell all goceries.washing soap is provided and u will find it in the machine.just open the loading door.wifi is limited to the lobby which was very inconvienient.staff are generally stuck up but i think its more fear than pride.its just a job to them.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: becksYorks
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the golden sands ten, excelent value for money in good location for all atractions. good supermarket across the road you can even buy pork products there, the apartment had a good size lounge large dining area seperate kitchen and seperate laundry room with washer and dryer. two bedrooms and two bathrooms, apartment was cleaned every day with bedding and towels changed daily, the pool area is closed in the apartments are built allround it but you get plenty of sun in the mornings and plenty of much needed shade.its is very easy to walk to the great metro system two stations within very easy reach, the metro is a very cheap way of getting around covers most atractions a lot cheaper and faster than taxis .dont expect luxery at these apartments but if you want good very clean comfortable accomidation at a very reasonable cost give these a go.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: bhavs09
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment in GS 10 and it served us well as we were 2 couples and an infant. The location is also convenient with a Spinnies supermarket just 5min away and plenty of restaurants at a short drive. Service was okay..apart from the things placed in the kitchen they are not very receptive to requests. We did not eat at coffee shop so do not have an idea of the food quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway from home”
Reviews.Author: divyaviswanath
Reviews.Content: Its a nice cozy getaway from home. The rooms are spacious and service is good.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Tiana B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay here on a regulare basis in the Golden Sands 10, (this would be the one which is a fully self contained flat) We have never had any issues regarding our stay, the location is central Dubai its about 15 minutes away from Jameira by taxi so if you are planning on spending your time there everyday you might end up spending quite a bit on taxi fares. Service has always been prompt, there is a really close supermarket called Spinneys literally 3 minutes away which is 24 hours which sells Waitrose produce and products, and within the complex there is also a 24 hour MacDonalds, its very useful for when you want to grab something really quickly to eat. It is about 10 mins walk away from the Burjuman shopping centre which has all the top high street brands and Centre point, which is a department store. Honestly I love this place, the serivce is brilliant, the staff are polite and the house keeping has ALWAYS been outstanding. I have stayed here 3 times now and not once have I ever had any issues regarding anything. The only reason I have given this hotel 4 out of 5 and not 5 out of 5 is because the breakfasts downstairs are a little bit more pricey than they should be and if you want to go to Mall of the Emirates or Wild Wadi waterpark it is a little bit far away from there and the reception would ask you for a 500 Dirham deposite on arrive against potential damages (obviously this money will get refunded back to you upon check out) but it can still be a little bit of a damper and cut your holiday money a little bit short when you go. Otherwise it is an absolutely a delight going there. We will continue to stay there

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: svetobeh
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family in studio for two weeks and apart from occasional smell we can not complain about anything. Do not expect royal service and facilities, but if you are looking for good value for money, this is definitely great choice. Breakfast seems to be expensive, we did not try it. But nearby is large supermarket where you can buy everything and city centre with variety of restaurants is walking distance. Tourists usually use taxi which are rather cheap but we found out Dubai has excellent public transport. There are bus stop and undergroud station nearby. Jumeraih beach for example is 15 min. by bus. GS will be definitely favorite if I will choose to go to Dubai again.

Reviews.Title: “staying”
Reviews.Author: samuel_pat
Reviews.Content: conceirgae was good and help, desk people were happy to help and adjust, room was spacious for 2 kids and wife and husband. atmosphere was good. room service prompt and nice. we stayed out most of time. but found room always comfortable.parking available. swiming pool and hotel restaunat we didnt use. as we at out and made our own tea. balcony was spacious.rate per night was good for purse.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sightseer2010
Reviews.Content: In dubai u can find a lot of hotels but i find out Golden Aand aa really good value for money. it is locates at the heart of ciyy. very near to metro station. i stayed for a week with my family and enjoyed my stay there. It need to increase it parking space as it was always hard to find the parking in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Like it”
Reviews.Author: Bookend48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Sands several times. Out of the 16(?) blocks of Golden & Silver sands the main two blocks for short vacations seem to be Golden Sands 3 & 5. In my experience the only difference seems to be one has a bigger kitchen area (3) and the other a bigger bathroom (5). Kitchenettes in block 5 are small but still have microwave, fridge/freezer, hob and toaster. Bathrooms are basic with tiled shower, but no bath tub. The rooms, and common areas, are kept very clean. Staff are very helpful, especially housekeeping staff. Check-in is straightforward although they do like to take a pre-authorisation on prepaid rooms.The rooms are good value at around £30 a night. There's a swimming pool in both of the blocks and a small fitness centre. Free daily shuttle to the beach park. The local area is pretty built-up and at first can,wrongly, be a bit off-putting. There are three Metro stations within a ten minute walk. Internet in both lobby areas. Wired free internet in room but this is very much on the slow side and lots of stuff gets blocked either by Golden Sands very sensitive Web controls, e.g. radio stations, Youtube often Yahoo etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget apartment”
Reviews.Author: NatSam74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at no. 10 for 2 weeks. Very spacious apartments. We had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living/dining room, kitchen and utility room containing a washing machine and dryer. Daily cleaning which was done very well, even washed up anything left in the sink! Any help we requested was given promptly with great politeness and courteousness. Nothing seemed to be an issue. Pool was kept very clean. 24hr supermarket right opposite was very handy! Location was fine, metro station less than 5 min walk although you tend to get taxis everywhere as they are so cheap. Only issue we had was that some of our clothes got caught in the drier and damaged them, manager dealt with it as soon as we reported it and did his upmost to accommodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: merito_10
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed over in Dubai on previous trips so decided to stay one night. We were more than happy with the hotel - close to shopping malls. Our only complaint was we visited during Ramadan and the temperature was mid 40's and we found it hard to find shops open during the day. In saying that we ate in the hotel which was great value. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Nina T
Reviews.Content: But to far out of town no shops or restaurants close by.One plus was they did have free internet when KIDS weren't using it ( although signs clearly state No Children To Use Computers)

Reviews.Title: “Lack of common sense”
Reviews.Author: Azharsyarawi
Reviews.Content: Salam I'd like to raise a complaint on the treatment of my family tonight 22nd of August 2011 by the management of Golden Sands 10. I live in a villa in Mirdif and my wife has just given birth to a baby girl in the past 10 days. Due to some electrical failures at home  which caused the airconditioning and water pumps to fail, and the fact that maintenance teams are only able to come tomorrow, we were forced to take lodgings in a service apartment. We subsequently booked ourselves into Golden Sands 10- party of 5 adults - wife, the maid, the in-laws who are visiting from Malaysia,myself and 2 children - the newborn and my 2 yr old daughter. Whilst checking in, we were told that passports are needed for the check-in. My immediate family and maid had all our documents but my in-laws didn't bring theirs - left at home in our rush check in. I was on the way back to secure the documents. What we had requested was for them to check in first - there were 2 young children and a mother who has just given birth. Meanwhile, I would be coming back within an hour tops with the passports. The management of Golden Sands 10 refused despite the situation. I cannot understand why such strict requirements are enforced with absolutely no thought. My family was left in the lobby for an entire hour until we could not take it and we subsequently chose a hotel. This is the kind of service that is being offered in Dubai and I am sad that it is being offered by such a good company - or so I thought. (ARENCO). the wife and I were previous tenants at golden sands 2 and had hoped that some semblance of common sense would prevail but it had not. I will be sharing this complaint with all and sundry. There are other providers out there and there is no doubt that I will dissuade others from using the Golden Sand's services. Azhar Syarawi [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: soteroamyrn
Reviews.Content: The place is nice and comfortable, feeling at home. The rooms are just enough for the family. Service are excellent and the food are great ! Staff served with a smile ... Very nice People...

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for money”
Reviews.Author: vips_02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Golden Sands Apartments as they have many buildings in the area. The Room was really nice and had every basic amanities you could think of. The staff was really helpful and you could not fault much. There is a shopping mall just a few minutes walk from the hotel and a Spinneys Suopermarket in case you need to buy few basics. Overall loved the saty with Golden Sands Thanks

Reviews.Title: “GS10 Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mitika M
Reviews.Content: Golden Sands Hotel apartments are pretty cheap and really good value for the money. I stay at the Golden Sands 10 on some short trips with family (2/3 BR apartments). They are very conveniently located with a 24hr supermarket and tons of restaurants just steps away. People at the reception are not extremely friendly, but they are courteous and get things done when you ask them to. The apartments in itself are nice, clean and very spacious. The kitchen is relatively well equipped too. The couches in the living room are pretty comfortable too. Something that I find convenient here is that there is no sharing of bathrooms. Each room has one to itself which makes it convenient while travelling as a family. E.g. 3BR has 3 bathrooms and 2BR's have two bathrooms. I have ever tried the breakfast downstairs so have no comments. They do have parking space available. The view is not particularly great from any side, but you are not paying for a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartments”
Reviews.Author: IrishCork85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in Feb '07 with my parents, sister & boyfriend. (Can't remember if we stayed in 3 or 10). My sister was teaching in Dubai at the time & she chose accomodation that was near to her but at the same time close to shops etc. so we would find easy to get around while she was working. These apartments were amazing. Very clean & built to a high spec yet very reasonable. The pool was small enough but there weren't many people around using it. Could only really go to the pool in the morning if you wanted to catch some sun as the high building around it blocked the sun after a certain time but it gets so hot anyway this is no harm. The hotel provides a bus to the beach but this was not from our apartments, we had to go to another apartment block to get this. The bus times weren't ideal though as they were not regular. Plenty of shopping near by with the Burjiman just a short walk away. We were also able to get irish bacon & sausages in Spinneys across the road from the apartments. Dubai has some amazing places to eat! Taxis are very plentiful & so cheap so we ate out in different places every night (my sister had a bit of research done on restaurants & we were not disappointed). Food was very cheap & lovely. The local people are fine. Would stay out of your way really. Plenty to do in Dubai also, visited the Burj and would deffinately recommend the Desert Safari but it's not for the faint hearted! Great fun Would most deffinately go back to Dubai again & would recommend the Golden Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Very large and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jane_beach
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 4 adults, had a very large 2 bedroom apartment in No 10. Helpful staff, supermarket across the road & taxis always available. Arriving at 3am was no problem as there is a 24hr desk. It was so hot when we were there we didn't walk anywhere unless it was in airconditioning...45deg C. Taxis are cheap & plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: beautyofqatar
Reviews.Content: The stay was nice, room was very good offered in Golden Sands 5. However, response from front desk was amazingly very very slow. Took almost half an hour for check-in. There was no slippers in bathroom, else it was very good in terms of cleanliness. Number of Indian Tv channels were just 1, thats ruined our party a bit, should have taken DVDs with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value for money”
Reviews.Author: amanah
Reviews.Content: Nice to have the facilities for self catering in a big city, especially good to have a washing machine. Easy location for getting around Dubai, staff always friendly and helpful. we have stayed here on many occasions and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We Thought, Wow! Good value too.”
Reviews.Author: Akash58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a 2bed apartment and I must all 3 of us were well impressed with how clean and spacious the apartment was. The bedrooms were large and comfortable. The bathrooms were comprable to some 5 star hotel we have stayed in. The kitchen had all the required facilities and I must say the cleaning staff did the tidy up nicely when we did not expect it. Dining area and lounge were spacious and comfortable. Staff were generally friendly and accommodating. When I enquired about wifi, I was given an internet cable and password so I could use it from my room. Terrific! A couple of tips. Firstly, do not book over the phone. Just check the price online and if you can book early then you should get thte earlybird offer. We did. Secondly, don't use the so called hotel taxi recommended by the porter. It is expensive and no more compfortable. Official yellow taxis are a plenty outside. The 24 supermarket was 2 minutes walk and we stocked up on food and drinks at good prices. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: HaroonTourist
Reviews.Content: I visited Duabi with my Family in last week June, 2011. We stayed at Golden Sands 3. We found it to be great value for money at AED 340 per night for a seviced apartment with room for 4. The apartment was comfy and had evertything such as Kitchen, Washing mAchine, Bedding for 4, Sofa Set, Coffeee table and 2 bathrooms. We had a real nice stay there. I feel it is ideal for family with young cheldren. Only thing that we wished was pool for children wich was missing. Also thebusiness center was free with decent speed internet available round the clock.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: uvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at Golden Sands 5 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Excellent studio apartment with most amenities including an ironing board and pressing iron. Used the rooftop swimming pool which was clean. All the whole, a memorable stay. Hope to visit Dubai again within a year as I enjoyed my whole stay there. Enjoyed the free internet in the room. Thanks to the staff for their courtesy and consideration. Hope to post pictures later.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCamel2176
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with plenty of storage space for luggage and clothes. Great apartment for a family. 2 bathrooms and the combined washing machine / dryer was a real bonus. Restaurant was good value.... nice hot breakfast buffet too. No alcohol served, so if you want a drink...you'll have to go to the bar at the nearby Sheraton Four Points. Not ideally located....apart from the BurJaman shopping centre, you would need to get a taxi to all attractions, etc....however, taxi's are cheap and in plentiful supply.....be warned though, they have a 'preferred' taxi operator who waits outside with the other taxi's but charges twice as much as the regular cabs.....to avoid the higher cost make sure you get the normal type cab, which is beige in colour with a coloured (red, green, blue, yellow, etc.) roof.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands Hotel Apartment : Premier Hotel Apartments”
Reviews.Author: bhavesh_2001
Reviews.Content: Like : Location : great central location Golden Sands Hotel Apartment is great place to be in when At Dubai. This Hotel Apartments is conveniently located at Bur Dubai very close to shopping, commercial & leisure districts in the heart of Dubai. Facility : great facility, very well furnished 1bed, 2 bed rooms. Resturant along with Gym swimming and and souna. Dislike : Not really

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying there for 3 months...”
Reviews.Author: smashingvicky
Reviews.Content: Am on a business trip & staying at Golden Sands 10 in Al-Karama, Dubai for last 3 months......its a really nice hotel apartment with gud ambience inside the flat (each flat has 2-3 rooms).....the staff is very supportive.....the best thing i liked is that they provide you with a kitchen where you can cook & they themselves wash the utensils next day.......coming to bad points, the hotel doesn't have wifi in rooms & you need to sit in hotel lobby for the same...

Reviews.Title: “average stay - but be prepared for cooking smell”
Reviews.Author: 06bubbles06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at golden apartment NO 3 ((i have heard golden sand appartment no10 is very nice and clean - there are 3 golden hotels) Location: 20 minutes from airport so not to far many taxis near hotel and on every street - we bought transfer beforehand but it worked too expensive - so get taxi when u arrive dubai its so cheap..(20 miutes drive = 40 -50 dharms = £8 -10)) !!! its about 10 minutes drive from burj khalifa...dubai mall n meena baazar 25 minutes drive from wild wadi n jumera beach - use taxis where ever you go in dubai there is a supermarket spinnys - less than 10 miuntes walk - very useful Hotel - the price is quite good esp in comparison to other hotels in dubai and you will notice because this hotel is packed - ppl checking in n out all the time !!! BUT the smell in the corridors - OMG OMG OMG its strong cooking smell - put us off on the 1st day - maybe staff found out - 2 days later the smell wasnt that bad - the staff are always cleaning n painting the corridors - weird!! Thank god it wasnt that bad - we were out all day so just came to sleep. We used the kitchen to make food - however it wasnt that equipped - very basic but we just about managed. We had 2 ensuites - it wasnt that clean - there is some weird smell - had no choice but to use it. Be prepared!!!!! The beds were ok - we got new sheets everyday and new towels too. This hotel has swimming pool but didnt get chance to use it - never saw it (lol)) as we were out all the days. Staff - the front desk were quite helpful...told us how to get to the main attractions n also has own bus that would usually leave about 9ish to go to jumeria beach or jumera park beach n come back around 4pm (free of charge). we had a problem with patio - didnt close - we rang the front dek n within 30minutes they sent som1 to have a look and sorted the problem out - IMPRESSED!! If you want a luxury hotel then i wouldnt recommend this hotel - there are many other hotels in duabi for that. However if you want to explore the beautiful city, looking for a place to cook your food and good value for money - this is a brilliant hotel. This part of the city is safe...just like the rest of Dubai..all the attractions are close by but you have to use a taxi to get to the places..i cnt stress how cheap taxis are..honestly...i would come back here again because the price of hotel is good BUT il try at stay at NO10 Golden sands since i have heard from friends that is better.

Reviews.Title: “Homely stay in a well equipped hotel apptt, good location”
Reviews.Author: travellerish
Reviews.Content: The stay was great. Small yet fully equipped appartment with washing machine, iron, kitchen area, microwave, fridge etc. Location is central, 5 min walk to burjuman and the metro station. Close by was a grocerry shop which had medicines and knick knacks. Nice pool at the roof top. Free internet. Tip: Ask for the tower which the reservation is for your room. There are 15 towers and the reservation does not specify the tower. Airport transfer was not provided for, even when we had requested for it.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, informal and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Mizz_Chilli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands 5 in March for 5 nights with my brother. We were on the second floor and whilst I would have liked to be on a higher floor I gave up asking them because all the room are exactly the same. There isn't much of a view anyway as you are surrounded by other buildings around you. I booked my stay through Expedia and when I arrived I did have to charge my card as a guarantee only but payment for my stay was already completed before we arrived. On arrival the bell boy takes all your bags up for you. You receive an electronic key for your room and you even need the key to call for the lift. The room had a small kitchen area and utensils are provided. There is a safe, a coat rack, a large fridge and freezer, a washing machine kettle (coffee and tea topped up daily) and a microwave. The bathroom is of decent size too with a large mirror, soaps are provided, toilet, bidet and a shower space with a shower curtain. The shower is quite powerful. The towels are changed daily. There were two single beds with two night stands and lamps, a telephone, about 2 or 3 pillows each, a desk with writing paper and 1 postcard, a pen, a chair for the desk, a very large mirror above the desk. There were also two chest of drawers and a TV with lots of channels. There is also an area which could be considered as your lounge. The was a 3 person sofa as well as 2 person sofa and a decent sized coffee table. There is a box of tissues there too. There was also a small table with 2 chairs which could be used to dine. The balcony is very small but you can fit a chair outside but not much else can be done there. The sofas are comfortable for sitting or falling asleep on and the beds are also quite comfortable. The curtains are quite heavy and thick so it keeps the hot sun out of the room in the morning. There is a restaurant in the building and the opening hours and the menu is in the room. There is a wide selection for you to choose from. If the restaurant is closed you can order food for your room. I think it but I cannot remember. I ordered once from there and my brother went to the restaurant to eat. The food portion is of decent size and the prices are "reasonable" however, the majority of the food sold there can be bought by places in close vicinity for half the price. You should not be put off by small labour looking places as the food in these places are something the best. The "Karachi Darbar" chain is excellent if you want to try Indian/Pakistan food. There is a pool on the rooftop which shuts about 8 or 10pm. I went there once and came straight back because it was filled with people all over the place trying to catch the sun and there was nowhere for me to leave my stuff as even the floor space was occupied by sunbathers. There is another pool on the 3rd floor I think which is quite small and looked like a much shallow pool. The area around it is quite large and the gym is also located here. My brother used the gym almost every day. They do not provided any sponge or washing up liquid so if you want it washed, leave it in the sink for the housekeepers. The apartment offer Internet but you have to ask at reception of a cable lead as the service is not wireless. The connection is pretty good. If you need a hair dryer, you need to request for it. There is also a business centre but we bought our own laptops so we did not make use of this facility. The nearest Metro station is the BurJuman station which takes approximately 15 minutes to get to. Taxis are a convenient way to travel but there is a minimum 10 dirham fare. We used the metro a lot and even if our final destination is not close to the nearby place, we still went by metro and then caught a taxi because if you caught a taxi directly from the hotel, it would have cost much more. Taxis from the airport have a minimum fare of 20 dirhams. There is a grocery store directly opposite the road if you want to buy milk, drinks, crisps, cornflakes, mobile top ups etc or there is a Spinneys supermarket about 5 minutes walk away as well. You cannot buy alcohol is shops in Dubai and the apartments do not sell alcohol. You will have to go to a bar or a hotel bar or a club. Beer is approximately 30 dirhams (£6) so I suggest you buy your booze from the airport on arrival. You can get crates from beer from the airport. If you find the cigarettes you smoke at the airport duty free on arrival, I suggest you buy it then as it beats looking for a local shop when you are out and about. If you want a SIM card whilst you are in Dubai, you can buy this from the airport. The operator is called "du" and you can find more information from their website. It take 1 hour to activate and comes with pre-paid credit. Hope you enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crossie
Reviews.Content: My wife had stayed in one of The Golden Sand complexes before and her sister had stayed in GS 5,a week ago,so we knew at least,it was acceptable.But we where suprised at just how good it was,for the price. We had an apartment,a large room,good size bathroom,fridge/freezer,cooker,microwave,ironing board and iron,cultlery, crockery,WS tv,air-con,phone,large bed,two settee,eating table,two chairs, and all very clean. Customer service was second to none,thet really could not do enough for you,eg,we took a corkscrew,to open wine,that you can buy at the airport,it broke,but a call to front desk,and one was delivered to the room in minutes, my wifes travel hair dryer,packed up,again one was brough to room.The room was cleaned daily to a very high standard,bedding was changed daily. Golden Sands is a large complex of accomadation,but an excallent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good if you are on a budget, but dont get excited!”
Reviews.Author: licclejo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted to go to Dubai for a holiday, and after ridiculous quotes at the travel agents, we thought we would try a build our own package through expedia. We managed to get a 10 night stay for roughly £500. We stayed in the Golden Sands 5 (when you book at Golden sands, you can be placed at any 1 of 10 Goldne Sands Hotels - all are very very close to each other) When you make your booking, I would suggest contacting the hotel to find out which one you are staying at in advance, so you can tell the taxi man where to drop you off. All in all, you pay for what you get. The reception is probably the smartest part of the hotel. The rooms are good, and adequate in size - just remember this is a cheap hotel, so don't expect a penthouse suite! We had an issue with the air con - twice on our stay water leaked from the air con in the roof in the bathroom - it was a bit smelly, but to be fair, they got a handy man to fix it straight away (even at 3am in the morning). Other than that the rooms were clean, and were serviced everyday with clean towels. The house keeping staff were friendly and trustworthy - one day i accidently left my purse full of money on the bed, and went out - the room was clean and tidy, and they put my purse on my pillow - nothing was missing. The location is a bit far out - in the bur dubai region but the taxi's are not expensive. We never paid more than £9 for a taxi ride - even when we were taking a long journey! The trips and tours that reception offer are minimal, but i do recommend the desert safari through knight tours - one of my best experiences ever! All in all, the hotel is good value for money, but i would only recommend it for short stays - I was deffo ready to go home after 10 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but Pathetically managed”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Mittal
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my colleague at Hotel Apartment Golden Sands 10 during visit to Dubai. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with a separate kitchen and Living room. The apartment is located prominently and conveniently, offering excellent options for food (multi cuisine restaurants, well stocked super market ) located stone throw . The place is accessible by all public transport and the cabs are easily available. The hotel lobby is spacious so are the rooms and facilities. However, the hotel is being managed by front office and customer service executives who are arrogant. Our initial stay was for a day and we were provided complementary mineral water bottle in apartment and while I extended the stay for two days the similar benefit did not come, the reasoning being that it is complementary for first day but not subsequent (let me clarify that, it was not a package deal but per night tariff). Then while checking in the hotel announcement board mentioned that the internet is free and also the breakfast at coffee shop. I was given the internet on asking but was denied the breakfast when I went to check the same on fourth day of stay (at the time of checking out) that it is not applicable on my tariff, which made embarrassed standing at coffee shop. Lastly, the Hotel apartment staff exercises discrimination between guests. As my friends were staying in the same hotel on business visit, which was only reason for me to choose this particular stay and to take a 2 bedroom apartment while I needed a single bedroom. My friends while they were accompanying their guests to their rooms who had come to visit them were charged extra for the persons visiting them. I am still unable to understand the logic behind this, since when you engage a 2 bedroom apartment which is fit for 4 persons and while also having vacant capacity why one should be asked to pay extra, at the same time a european guest was seen walking happily to his room with 5 guests. The staff at the reception was rude and had problems after problems for any issues. The end of all problems for them was extra money, which seems to be their only mandate while managing the reception area. The free parking for guests at the hotel advertised in brochure is free but on full tariff. So a good hotel with a bad management. can be avoided as there are several hotel apartment which are equally good for location and other things .

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: cammyxxoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dubai Golden Sands 3 for three nights during a stopover on our way to Morocco. The room and the service we received at Golden Sands 3, our first visit to Dubai, was fantastic. Our room consisted of two bathrooms, a main bedroom with another two single beds in the main living area. The kitchen had everything we needed, including a washing machine. When we couldn't get it working, someone came straight up and started it for us! The room was spacious and comfortable with couches and a dining table. The bathrooms were clean. The staff were extremely helpful. The only downside was that we couldn't use our balcony because of a pigeon nest in the eaves - droppings everywhere! Golden Sands 3 (and the rest of the complex) is about a 10 minute walk to the Dubai Creek and the Souks. We only spent one afternoon here, and the rest of the time we travelled into the newer part of Dubai - for shopping, dinner, waterpark etc... We caught taxis everywhere, and these taxis were always waiting for us outside the hotel - you never needed to get the hotel to call them. On the way back home to Australia, we stayed at the Grosvenor House, the completely other end of the hotel star spectrum, but would rate both hotels as good as one another! At the Grosvenor tho, you would be waiting about 10 minutes for a taxi to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and well equiped”
Reviews.Author: angela55
Reviews.Content: WI stayed here with a friend for 8 nights (Golden Sands 5) and it was very clean and spacious with washer/dryer, fridge/freezer and cooking facilities. The downside was- no bar in the (very good) restaurant, in fact no bar at all. This is 2011 for goodness sake! We struggled to get the card key to work and were constantly having to get it sorted at reception. There is a bus to the beach and the outlet mall but these are not advertised, nor is the fact that you have to book beforehand for the beach bus. overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: annie2156
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Golden Sands apartments (number 3 - there are about 10 different aprtment blocks) for 5 nights. Typical 3 star hotel really, studio room was spacious and clean but bathroom could do with updating. Breakfast was ok - same things every morning and not much choice compared to what have had in other 3stars. Location is good for the old part of the city, you will get taxis everywhere anyway, taxi to Burj Khalifa/Dubai mall will only cost you about 20-25 dirhams (£4 approx) for 20min taxi ride! Dont use the hotel taxi service though - make sure you flag down a cream one with different coloured roof - the hotel ones are not metered and will cost you more, as we found out!! Overall a good base to explore dubai, but dont stay if you want luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service and good for value”
Reviews.Author: cherylandrichie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands Apartment 3 just 2 days ago. We understood it to be only a 3 star apartment so we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived and got 5 star treatment. There was someone there to open the door for us, greet us and get our luggage. We arrived from our Emirates flight very early getting to the hotel at about 7:30 am. We had only paid for one night and were going to leave the luggage there until check in at 2pm. The hotel staff allowed us to immediately check in from 7:30 am without needing to pay a night (ofcourse this was probably subject to the room being available) Also, he knew we needed to check out by 5am the next day so the front desk staff encouraged us to use our free breakfast on the day we arrived. We never got to try this though as we had to leave for Dubai Mall for our ticket to Burj Khalifa. We paid for the queen bed studio apartment. It was a large and clean room. My only issue would be (and I'm not sure if it's like this everywhere in Dubai) the toilet water was way too high in the toilet bowl. I mean if you saw that back home, you might think the toilet was blocked. But the toilet worked fine in the hotel. The staff are incredibly helpful people and our feeling from our experience there is customer is always first. Put it this way, they will never allow you to open doors or carry your luggage yourself. They will always go to you and offer their help. Some other things you might want to know: Taxi ride from airport to Golden Sands - Not sure how much this would cost but we arranged a private transfer in Australia for AUD 30 each way through Orient Tours. Taxi ride from Golden Sands to Dubai Mall - Cost us approx. 25 AED each way. The distance was about 15 minute drive. Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: northeastvillafan
Reviews.Content: stayed there at the end of feb for 3 nights. arrived early morning from austrailia and had contacted them in advance of our early arrival. to my surprise they had a room waiting and we checked in which was great for us. we stayed in gs5 on the same floor as the pool and although the room was a little dated in appearance it was good for the price clean,and the addition of kitchen facilities and wash machine a bonus. staff were friendly and helpful. ate in the restaurant on the last night and would describe it only as average and was a little dissapointed. its a little away from things however taxis were cheap and we managed to do quite a lot of things and still chill out a little by the pool. be aware if you wish to visit tallest building in the world as its quite expensive if you just turn up and you need to book well in advance if you want the cheaper option which wasnt available to us as we were only there for 3 nights. a few supermarkets around the area and found spinnys to be the best although not much choice for beer. bought beer at the airport on the way in which turned out to be a good idea as we didnt really drink anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Best”
Reviews.Author: Dhaman
Reviews.Content: Room was good, nice and clean. This is something different then the usual hotels. The room has Washing machine, Kitchen with complete utencils, cutlery and stuff. The Hotel apartment provides cleaner to clean the used dishes. Service was very good / Prompt Service.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: Pleasant & helpful staff. Good sized room, very clean and well equipped with cooker, washing machine, fridge, etc. Buffet breakfast had fair choice and able to sit inside or outside facing pool. Dinner menu good and reasonable prices. Situated fairly close to shops & transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: tollerup
Reviews.Content: There rooms are very Large with tre beds and two toilets and a very nice kitchen. The hotel is good when you travel with kids. The pool is small, but okay. You can go on the internet for free. The location is not good, you need a taxi when you go out of the door. The hotel is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, dont land in”
Reviews.Author: sheeruz
Reviews.Content: Although you can see it as very cheap and great location benefits, i would think twice to go over there. Good -location - free parking -cheap - free internet bad - wired connection - dirty -stingy - 1990's towels - small bathrooms - free flow machines - bad cutlery - oven with last guest left over
