Reviews.Title: “Your home away from home in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: NJGandhi
Reviews.Content: One of the perfect hotel apartment which gives you a feeling of your home away from your home in Dubai. Very good, comfortable hotel apartment with complete ameneties available in the apartment. Best hotel apartment with very good hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 5- great week”
Reviews.Author: NomadicTeachers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Golden Sands 5. Bathroom a bit scruffy but ,as with rest of the studio apartment it was adequate. Used the pool on the roof - good. 5 is joined to 3 where there is another pool, internet connections and small restaurant with an outside eating area - had breakfast there one morning which was OK. However, both in Golden sands and elsewhere there are loads of eating places to suit all tastes and pockets. We lived in Dubai previously, so chose the Golden Sands area because we knew it was a good location. Weather was cool so we could walk to the creek, metro station etc. Metro was new for us and very useful although taxis are still cheap. Had a great week.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the Golden Sands 3...OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: gilliepie
Reviews.Content: Having decided on an impromptu trip to Dubai (being a resident of nearby Fujairah) I booked the Golden Sands apartment studio with 2 rooms last minute. The price was unbelievably good value-Only £220 for 4 people for 2 nights. The rooms were incredibly clean, almost glimmering. The hotel was easy to find with all the other golden sands hotels nearby, it was almost like being in a community of golden sands.The location is perfect (if you have your own transport) The stand out of the hotel had to be the staff. The concierge and front desk were slick and professional, checking us in and out quickly and without fuss. The porter was the highlight of the stay. His manners were impeccable and he did not mind taking our numerous heavy bags to our room and even to our car. The internet was free in the rooms and in the cafe, what a bonus!!! We ordered room service one night. it was cheap and delicious. My compliments to the chef on his heavenly veg curry. We did not sample the pool however we had a peek and it looked clean and surrounded by the bronzed beauties you only find in Dubai!! I can honestly say this was the best, hassle free hotel experience I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “value for money, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: palls19
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Golden Sands 5 during our honeymoon, everything was good except the "free" internet died on us every alternate hour, and at first the housekeeping was excellent and then we had to ask them like 3 times a day just to furnish the coffee, teas, sugars etc. the location is very good with taxis pullingup every 3 mins outside the door. thankfully we spent most of our time outside, coz otherwise we wud get throughly bored indoors! The TV had some good channels but the rooms were not that great to want to spend lots of time in. But you get what you pay for. p.s the hallways always smell of curry!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartments and thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: purpletravller
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 who had booked 2 apartments in Golden Sands 10. We found the apartments to be clean, spacious and perfect for our trip. 3 bedrooms, large kitchen and dinning/sitting area plus sufficient bathrooms. The buffet breakfast was great and the menu changed daily. While we didnt use the pool facilities we enjoyed eating our breakfast by the pool. There is always a regular supply of taxis outside which are very cheap. Great supermarket nearby which was handy. We would all recommend this hotel/apartment. Dubai is fab, dont forget to barter in the souks - great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: gh0sted
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Sands 6 for a few days as my other half works in the region. The hotel itself was very good; the staff were very helpful and and the room was large, well equiped, very clean and there was always fresh bottled water. We only used the restaurant once and it seemed expensive but the breakfast buffet was really nice and very well presented. Would happily stay there again, but (as with everywhere in Dubai?) be prepared to get taxis everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good & quiet location, neat apartments, value for money, good cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: morpheuskc
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10, so we took up two sets of 2 BR apartments at the Golden Sands 10. The rooms were excellent, well maintained. The service was very good, the staff was helpful and courteous enough. Taxis are easily available. The hotel apartment has two pools apart from a squash court, and a ping pong table and some small gaming zone for kids. Spinney's departmental store is bang opposite the apartment and open 24 hrs including a money exchanger. Some of the malls like Burjuman Centre and the nearest metro are walking distances (5-10 min) from the hotel. Free wired internet is provided. You can either take your own cable or they did give it without charges. So .. all in all we had an excellent time. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Everyone in Dubai knows Golden Sands so getting there isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 3.....excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 3 for a short stop over in Dubai on transit to Europe. Our early morning arrival was no trouble to staff who got us into our room by about 7.00 AM - we expected to leave our baggage and go touring. We found the staff excellent and always helpful during our stay. As there are a number of buildings in the Golden sands group, and our booking did not stipulate the location, the taxi drver dropped us at No. 2 where the staff quickly redirected us to the correct building. The room was an average hotel fitout that clean, quiet and comfortable with efficient air conditioning however the hot water to the bathroom was poor. The restaurant was good value and staff very attentive. The buffet breakfast had good variety. The hotel is relatively inexpensive for Dubai however it is not close to trains or attractions - we did a lot of walking and did not have time to master the bus system. If travelling by bus beware of the female only section and save any embarassment. The train system is very modern and efficient. Taxi seemed the best value for getting around from the hotel. We opted for a private car to do a short tour of the city (Hassan from Khyber Luxury Transport looked after us very well for the three or so hours)

Reviews.Title: “Would never return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We Were booked in goldensands 3 in a 2 room studio for a 3 night stopover on way home from Australia, recommended by our travel agent. Very disappointed when we arrived, basic, dated, room smelt "very musty" like it had not been used for a very long time. Not what we were expecting both from our travel agent & from looking it up online. Definately not 4 star! We left and booked ourselves in somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not very well kept and watch your belongings!”
Reviews.Author: Afroqueen50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice: in January 2010 and September 2010. Both times with two small children. The children enjoyed the swimming pool thoroughly (pool is quite clean), which was good. Also the restaurant serves impeccable food. Supermakets and take-away places nearby. Kitchenette and washer/dryer were okay,and the cleaning lady does your dishes. That is for the good part. BUT the hotel is old and not very well kept. Staff looks bored and thus not very warm.... No bath thub, so hard to bathe my one year-old. Had to ask for room to be cleaned after we checked in, as wall and closets were covered in grease,as were the floor tiles... When I last stayed there, my brand new perscription glasses disappeared from my room. The person in charge of security came and asked if I wanted to report this to the police,but since I was leaving the next morning, opted not to. They said they would investigate and keep me updated by email, but never did. Oh, and my neighbours complained of mould in shoes and closets! Gym is tiny with 3 treadmills, a few weights and a workout station. Pool pretty crowded. Sauna never worked 9during both stays) Also, given constant contruction in Dubai (and this area is no exception), be prepared for drilling, hammering noise all day until 10 p.m. The area is pleasant, located near bus and metro stations. A few small neigbourhood shopping centers (Spinneys,etc...) . Please avoid taxis parked in front of hotel, as they are more expensive than Dubai taxis and other companies (which pass in front of hotel constantly and can be hailed at any time). Would not recommend this hotel, unless one is seriously not particular about anything!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel afew things to mention though”
Reviews.Author: crazyshopper45
Reviews.Content: this hotel offers nice large rooms. we had a kitchenette and dining area with a sofa which was good. there was a tv with with a range of different channels but we didnt really watch anything as we were there to explore. we had newspapers nearly every mornings. the place was cleaned by the cleaners. the sheets were clean and replaced apart from the last day but i have noticed they tend to do this on the last night of stay. the room was actually quite large for us and it had a seperate bathroom which was a decent size . THE BATHROOM: please note when we had showers the shower tray would block up and we got poo coming up it. it was disgusting. the ventialtion was a bit poor on there too. THE STAFF: were great! they spoke english well and very helpful but expected to be tipped most of the time. the reception staff were well mannered and helpful, but they didnt tell us about the childcare facilties/room and where the pool was and i think there was a shuttle service but they didnt really tell ust till last day. THE LOCATION: was a bit troublesome for the taxi drivers as they couldnt always find it, due to there being so many Golden Sands Phases _1 2 3 4) etc etc. there was a small pharmacy nearby and a telephone booth right outside the hotel which we used to call home and check on things( we used a phonecard for this works out cheaper) there arent really any retsuarants a=or shops outside the hotel where you can grab a cheap bite or lunch, but you would have to walk or take a taxi to the main road near burjaman where there is macdonalds and kfc pizza hut etc.it isnt really near the markets/souks. it is near the burjaman shopping mall which is very expensive, however we did bag a great deal on a shisha there for £20. the hotel is great just needs the improvements int he bathroom and the balcony had a machine thing that was very loud and sometimes dusty. balcony was a good size but no views from this hotel unfortuantely as there is phase 2 golden sands bang opposite and you literally look into the residents apartments. quite area. we were with a 5 year old so needed to taxi it to most places.pool was nice but we didnt get to use it due to touring the city. the rooms were not old fashioned but simple junky wood beds and comfortable. no bright curtains just nice and simple. i wouldnt recommend it for the simple reason that it has to sort out the poo coming up from the showers

Reviews.Title: “Good value in expensive cty”
Reviews.Author: JKM2011
Reviews.Content: Golden Sands No 3, Dubai Our Emirates Airline ‘Stopover’ package worked seamlessly at a very reasonable price. It included transfers, breakfast and room. We arrived at the Golden Sands at 7.30 am after a 19.5 hour flight. Because check-in was at 2.00pm we expected to store our baggage and find something to do for the next 6.5 hours. However the desk clerk had other ideas. “Go and have breakfast,” he said, “and I’ll see what I can do.” After an excellent breakfast in the hotel restaurant we were able to move into our room; a comfortable, modern and spacious L shaped bed sitting room with kitchen facilities, balcony and large bathroom. The large menu in the restaurant provided choice for a wide variety of preferences, all the ingredients of the best quality, immaculately prepared and presented. However, the best feature of the Golden Sands is the staff in: in reception, restaurant and housekeeping; everyone efficient, polite, cheerful and obviously a happy and dedicated team; a sign of good management. Golden Sands No3 is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: mcwcBaku
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel - big (2-bedroomed) apartment including washer and drier, even; good sized pool; sauna... Very good. Friendly staff but needed reminding before things got done. Good location - just across a parking-lot from a 24-hour supermarket - which incidentally also helped taxi drivers locate our particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands Hotel Apartments in Dubai was very good”
Reviews.Author: a1111
Reviews.Content: I was in Golden Sands Apartment number 3 and would recommend this Hotel to everybody, it's a great Hotel apartment with all the facilities, I stayed there for 3 nights and very glad of everything, it was very clean, excellent ac and good service. The stuff was very helpful and I had asked to wake me up for the day of my departure and not only the automated phone call woke me up also they called me. The location is in Bur Dubai which is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Stay”
Reviews.Author: allaroundtheworld05
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Golden sands 5 for 4 days. WE had a very good stay. Rooms were cleaned everyday. Staff was courteous and helpful. Staff in the reception was also nice. Room was good. i stayed on the 5th floor. only Bathroom was small with no bath tub which was not a major issue with me and my family. Overall very good hotel. I would definitely stay next time when i visit dubai!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Value for money, Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: bigidea089
Reviews.Content: Actually, I work in Sharjah. But I stayed for 5 Days in Jan-2010, when my school friends visited Dubai. I stayed in Golden Sands IV. First of all, location is very amazing. On walkable distance Shopping Malls, Computer Market, 24 Hours Super Markets. The best part is ... its very near to Meena Bazaar ( Like little India of Dubai). Room service was also good. Overall my experience is so much good, I am planning to go for long term rental from Golden Sands IV.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: Mimozaph
Reviews.Content: My fiancee visited me in DXB for 15 days last September 2010. It was a big nightmarish looking for affordable hotel apartments. Most are expensive but we learned that it depends on the season. Summer like September is okay but from November till May, most hotel and apartelles in DXB are expensive. Also you may want to book in advance (always!) to get the best deal and offer. The overall experience was EXCELLENT and I am not exaggerating! we actually expected to be dissapointed as price was AED 250/night for a studio apartment. It is great for family travelers and couples who want a homey place to stay at. Room was really spacious, bathroom was great with complimentary soaps, shampoos and toothbrushes, towels too. A queen size bed, and big flat screen telly, huge sofas and coffee table, dinning table. A kitchenette, and everything u need for cooking. Saves u lots from spending on dining out! Room also equipped with a laundry machine and ironing stuff. It was really worth every penny! Two pools to loll around. Nearby grocery store too! Location is very accessible. Near Burjuman Mall, Hotels for night outs and metro train to roam around DXB. Also 5 minute cab drive to the beach. It is the best deal for weekly and monthly stay in DXB!

Reviews.Title: “excellant value central location”
Reviews.Author: bangorgooner
Reviews.Content: we went for a quick week over the half term period and were very surprised at the rooms we had een told it was a bit dated. We found the room excellant good fridge clean and comfortable the pool was small but adequate as the hotel was quiet. the food in the restaraunt was good although we only had lunch a few days the price was good also. the location was very close to the new train station at al karama which was easy for travel to malls etc. An enjoyable stay if you on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for money”
Reviews.Author: tollo652
Reviews.Content: We got a big appartment in Dubai for around GBP 100 per day. " bedrooms. It's pretty basic and the bathrooms have a dmap problem, but the location is great, good space and great value. The onsite facilities are nothign to shout about, but there is the Burjaman Centre 5 mins walk away with restaurants, food court and play area. Spinneys is just over the road. Taxis are simple to get and in no time at all you can be down in Dubai. Space in the appartment was great for the kids and with it being very basic, there was little or nothign for them to break.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot beat this at this price”
Reviews.Author: MMDAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands during our recent holiday end September,2010 in a 3 bedroom apartment. The apartment far exceeded the standard as per pics on their website- in fact it couldn't be better. The lounge,rooms,toilets,kitchen etc. were spacious and very much to our satisfaction. It even had a huge balcony. I'd strongly suggest this hotel for any family with young children. N.B.The only downside was that the porter broke the wheel of our biggest suitcase and we had to buy a new one. No hard feelings though :-).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Excellent value for Money, Lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstie1986
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive about going to Dubai after hearing some bad reviews on the Internet, but this hotel was great. Our flight arrived in Dubai at 8am and although check in wasn't until 2pm (I think) we were allowed straight to our room. Our room was spacious and was equipped with fridge, freezer, washing machine, cutlery, etc. We also had a balcony (no chairs or table). Great Aircon. The bathroom could do with an update but other than that the apartment was in good condition. We had a problem with our key card and were moved to another room (with a bigger bed) and given a complimentary fruit basket for our trouble. We were slightly worried about things we had heard about Dubai before we left (e.g. It being illegal for unmarried couples to share hotel rooms) however the staff at Golden Sands were lovely and helpful and didn't question us about this. Out of respect if we were asked by anyone else in Dubai we just said we were married . Room service was also good and relatively cheap. Overall I would stay here again. Although you have to take a taxi most places (which are cheap enough) I think it's a better option than spending hundred of pounds more to stay in Jumeira. The hotel itself is in Bur Dubai and is approximately 20 minutes from the airport (30DHS), 10 minutes from Dubai Mall (15DHS), 20 minutes from Mall of Emirates/Burj Al Arab (35DHS) and about 30 minutes from Atlantis (55DHS). There are approx 10 Golden Sands in the same area - we stayed in Golden Sands 3. Don't expect a good view from the balcony - just a view of the other Golden Sands. This hotel is perfect for a city break/beach but do not come for honeymoon etc there are far more luxurious places. Tip 1) do not use the taxis (unmarked) parked outside the hotel - turn left and hail a Dubai Taxi as they're cheaper Tip 2) Go to the book shop in Dubai Mall and buy a book called "The Entertainer". This book is full of BOGOF vouchers for hundreds of restaurants and attractions in Dubai induing Atlantis, the Snow Park and Dolphins. The book cost £50 but we saved over £230 between the two of us in a week. Tip 3) Change your sterling spending money in the mall as exchange rate was 5.8 (better than UK at 5.4. Tip 4) Go to 360 bar near Jumeira Beach Resort - stunning views Tip 5) Book the Burj Khalifa online before you go as it costs 100 DHS rather than 400 DHS on the day. Tip 6) Men should take jeans, shirt and shoes to get in some of the restaurants. Women are fine with strappy tops. Tip 7) It was hard to find a lot of nightlife or anywhere to get a beer. We liked the Hilton (Dubai Marina), 360 bar (Jumeira Beach Resort), Waxy O'Connors (Bur Dubai), Irish Village (Bur Dubai), Barrasti (near Dubai Marina).

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Appartments on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mih1954
Reviews.Content: Firstly when you get your booking confirmed make sure you know which block you have been allocated. There are at least 10 Golden Sands buildings over several blocks in the same area, all numbered. Rooms very basic , but clean,. Staff helpful. Two single beds a kiitchen area with micro etc. Seating area, pool. No bar. There was an eatery but very basic, poor selection. We did not use it. Stay away from the Sheraton Hotel, the nearest hotel bar from our building, if you want a drink. The drinks are very seriously expensive. Taxis are so cheap in Dubia it is unimportant where you stay. A taxi ride to most places is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant 2 week stay and would go back”
Reviews.Author: Atari
Reviews.Content: Stayed in block 5, room cleaned each day all nec. things for self catering kettle, oven rings, micro. etc. and there is a corner shop just round the corner which sells everything you need. Has pool with saunas and (restaurant not used this). Plenty of hotels in walking distance to eat and drink as the G/Sands does not have bar. 5 minute walk to metro and plenty of taxis to get outside. There is a guy at the entrance to apts.who asks you if you would like a taxi, we said no has the ones they get you are coloured white and charge more, best getting your own one with coloured roofs. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: rat68
Reviews.Content: There were 4 people in this 2 bedroom apartment. It was spacious and clean. It had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (careful with the taps as the cold water is actually hot), full kitchen, washing machine, dryer, dining room/lounge room. The airdonditioner was working a treat and the tv had a good selection of channels. We found the rooms to be modern, spacious and clean. The room overlooked the sparkling pool, which was well used by us. There were table and chairs with sun lounges around the pool. Reception staff were accommodating and polite. There is also a sauna and gym and a games room (table tennis). We didn't use these so I can't comment on their overall state. Make sure you use the marked taxis not the ones connected to the hotel (big mistake) as we had a bad experience with them. Marked taxis are cheap and strictly governed so don't be fooled into using the other so called VIP ones. Hotel overall was good value for money. If I was returning to Dubai, I would stay here again. Spinneys supermarket was a life saver. The small shopping centre also had a pharmacy, Mc Donalds, money exchange and a couple of little shops and a public toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JapaneseFrog
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel as it was cheap (£30 per night for a studio apartment for two). I didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised by the accommodation. We stayed in Golden Sands 5 and the room was large with a HUGE bed, lounge area and very small kitchen. All appliances were in working order and I bought enough for our breakfast at the local shop. Reception was friendly. There is also a small pool which was nice after a long day of work. The only negative points would be that, although the bathroom was clean, it was a little tired and grubby around the edges, also there was no cold water (!). The hotel is not in the touristic area like Jumeirah, etc. but tourism wasn't the purpose of my trip so location was not a problem. Also taxis are cheap in Dubai (and make sure you get the official Dubai taxis). Overall I would recommend this place as a cheap and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirlyGirl
Reviews.Content: After17 hours on 2 flights, I arrived in Dubai totally out of it. I *wanted* to stay at the Premier Inn, but was sent to a Golden Sands reservation booth. I should have gone with my instincts, but I was tired and the price sounded good. The front desk clerk seemed nice enough, and the bell man was very friendly. I got to my room (111 in Golden Sands #3). Granted, these apartment hotels are a great way to save money because you can cook for yourself. The room was tired but fairly clean. It had a weird smell. I don't know if I got a smoking room, but at the time, I was too exhausted to care. Nice hot shower and I went to sleep. After I woke up a few hours later, I had a problem with the A/C but the maintenance person came right away. I was ill from a medication issue, so the smell and the A/C problem did not help the throwing up. I needed more sleep, but didn't want to miss my flight to Bahrain in the morning. I asked for a wakeup call because trying to do it from my phone did not work. I never got the call. Thankfully, I was already up a half hour before the scheduled call that never came. The buffet breakfast was really good - extensive. I understand needing to save money, especially if you are bringing kids. There must be better apartment hotels out there, though, at a similar price point. I wouldn't stay here again, although it was an adequate place to throw up in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: swmarie513
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Orbitz for under $70 USD for one night. The lobby personnel were relatively friendly and helpful. The room was clean and even had a mini kitchen area (which we didn't use). The location is not very good. Expect a 10 to 15 minute cab ride to get to the city center/touristy area. There is a small mall within walking distance. If you are short on time, you may considered paying a little bit more and staying close to the Jeremiah Beach area. Always try to take a marked taxi. My friend and I made the mistake of taking a private car parked right outside of the hotel (the guy was in the hotel taxi booth so seemed legit), and his car was metered, however the driver was relatively rude once he realized he would not convince us to pay him for the day to take us around on a city tour.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: lookoftheirish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands 3 for a 2 night stop over in August 2010, they are located about 20 mins away from the airport, but there is nothing else around the hotel apart from other hotels and offices!! We had to travel 40 mins in a taxi to reach Jumeirah Beach, the Dubai Mall (the best one in Dubai) is about 10/15 mins away in a taxi. The apartments were very good value for money, but if I was to go to Dubai again I would definitely pay more to stay in a big hotel on Jumeirah Beach.

Reviews.Title: “All you could wish for in a short, economical stay”
Reviews.Author: Loobyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Sands 3 on our way back from visiting family in Australia and have to say it was wonderful. The staff were so friendly, it was really convenient for all the shopping and activities and we couldn't fault it. We ate breakfast in the restaurant within the Golden Sands which had very pleasant staff and good food. Wonderful for an inexpensive stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annisha007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands 3 from 24/07 - 30/07. Staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating arranging check in when I arrived which was at around 7 - normal check-in is 12:00. Cleaning staff could have a done a better job. The apartment was comfortable and spacious even for 2. Will definitely stay there again. Location was great, within walking distance from Spinneys and taxis are always readily available. Just something to take note of if travelling on a budget is that the "luxury taxis" arranged by Golden sands have a minimum fare of 20dhs where Dubai taxis minimum fare is 10dhs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a large family”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMarkJ
Reviews.Content: We ( Six ) stayed for 4 nights in a 3 bedroom apartment. Great size with all the things you need in a self contained apartment. Has a supermarket across the road and easy walking distance from the train station and only a short taxi ride from the airport. Free internet in the room was a plus, as well as the computer in the foyer. Has a full laundry, but I would suggest you do a dummy load first as we had our first load come out with stains from whatever the last person had in the machine. Staff were very apologetic and we were given a fruit basket for our inconvenience. Breakfast was very basic and we would have been better off making our own in the well appointed kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 10 was great!!”
Reviews.Author: mohd_shariq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 10 which was perfectly located in the heart of city. Burjuman mall was nearby where we could walk down every evening for good shopping. Hotel staff was friendly and rooms were neat and tidy. Cabs were readily available and the pool was good. All in all I'd say it was a pleasant stay and I hope to stay in this hotel yet again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ramin-Raiszadeh
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Dubai traveler. This was the first time that I stayed in Golden Sands. The room was large and fully equipped (all regular things + washing machine, iron, microwave, washing sink, kitchen utensils). The bathroom was very good (though, the cold water was hot!). At the arrival I noticed that the air conditioner was not working properly. I notified the reception and it was fixed in 10 min. The staff were friendly. The location is good, 10 min walk to Burjuman Mall. Taxis were always waiting at the door step (16 Dhs to city center and 25 Dhs to Dubai Mall). The metro station was something like 15 min walk (the weather did not permit for walking so I always used taxi). The only negative point I found was that the toilets were not cleaned properly everyday, which of course might not be the norm of the hotel, and could be the fault of the cleaner. You might find all these things in many hotels but the most amazing thing about this hotel is that you get all these for a very reasonable price. I paid about $50 per night for a studio (me,my wife and 9yo son). Such hotel could be at least 4 times this price in my home country or in London. I definitely return to this hotel in my every next trips to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Some room for improvements”
Reviews.Author: Indochina92
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, the location is not too bad, they have 2 swimming pool available, overall the value for money is not bad. However: - Breakfast is not always included - Internet is available in the room but only through Ethernet cable (bring your cable) - They have the strongest web filtering restrictions I have ever experienced, even a VPN won't go through, so it's only web surfing, no chating, no download, no games...

Reviews.Title: “Decent bolt hole in the city”
Reviews.Author: michaelstrachan
Reviews.Content: Went here for the weekend with some friends. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The bathrooms were a bit basic- but at this price it's acceptable. The room service was cheap, tasty and fast. If you're just going to Dubai for the weekend and need somewhere to dump your stuff and sleep this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: qrpw
Reviews.Content: Great value- big apartment, bedroom, living room, 2 bathrooms with bidets, kitchen. Quality TV, fridge, sink, oven, rangehood, ironing board, and other appliances, great for cooking. Very clean and proper, reception was okay, quite busy though, porter was good. There was free internet in the lobby, and you could get wireless in the room as well. Good location, 5 minutes walk to Spinneys supermarket, Burjuman mall, but otherwise took taxi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortabel”
Reviews.Author: AbbyWoburn
Reviews.Content: nice, clean, comfortable with great value and great location. The place was huge with large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient.. its a home!”
Reviews.Author: manishpersonal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 10.. the rooms were nice.. the kitchen well stocked with utensils etc. the phone directory allowed for easy navigation of the city.. and best of all the grocery store was next door and very cheap. Pros: great location and spacious rooms, balcony, good staff, nice indoor pool Cons: cramped parking, no frills. I would highly recommend this as a alternative to expensive hotels in Dubai. This might not be fancy, but is so home-like, you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: DeepaDani
Reviews.Content: The Golden Sands Hotel Apartments is conveniently located in Bur Dubai area, right behind the Burjaman Mall. We stayed in a 3 bed room apartment which was spacious and adequately furnished. The rooms were large, centrally air conditioned with big clean bathrooms and ample wardrobe space. The fully equipped kitchen, washing room with a washing machine and dryer, drawing room and the dining area were huge in size and we enjoyed hosting our guests too. The hotel has a big swimming pool, kids activity zone (mostly video games and some toys). They offer a free shuttle service to and fro the airport, which we used. The hotel staff has ample information to share about touristy places (mainly the malls), city day trips, desert safari and excursions to the adjoining Emirates. They are stocked with pamphlets and brochures of various tour operators. The hotel staff was courteous. Taxis are available on call and local transport is no problem. There is also a Hop On- Hop Off coach service that leaves from the Burjaman Shopping Mall after certain intervals. This is convenient (as the Hotel is right behind) and reasonably priced at the same time. The apartment hotel was a good option for us as we were traveling with a big family. We were 5 adults (including 2 couples) and 3 kids (all under 5 years of age). We got great value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, but crowded Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ashtop
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms. Very comfortable. Beds. Bathrooms. Washing machine inside room helped a great deal without having to worry about going to a common room and guarding your clothes! There are not many shops nearby. Just a convenience store and one restaurant. Anything else, you need to catch a cab. Dubai is crowded. So you need to leave early to get to any place on time. Book a cab over phone - don't depend on catching one outside the hotel. We had a shuttle bus between the hotel and the convention center for the show. So it was easier for us. The location is in a quiet location. So assured sleep after a day's work!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Pleased”
Reviews.Author: oldschool916
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at Golden Sands 5 very much, Hotel staff was vey friendly and not intrusive or overly friendly but ready to assist needed. Breakfast was satisfactory enough that we ate every morning. The only difficulty noted was the location as Golden Sands has many other buildings in the area which may make it your particular building difficult to find. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: heyhey38
Reviews.Content: everything was fine except the toilets . they were very low down , which as a result meant the water was at a very high level. this was very un hygenic as the dirty water would raise to the top whilst using the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDaveLincoln
Reviews.Content: What a great place, really impressed with what we got for our money. We had a stoppover in Dubai on our way home from 6 months in Asia, we had a free stoppover with Emirates and so thought why not? My biggest worry was the cost of accomodation so i went on the web and found this place.What a bargain ,i paid 50 quid altohugh i've seen it since for 40 ! The rooms are clean ,its quiet and central.We hired a car and toured all 7 emirates and one of the highlights of this trip was these apartments.We stayed in golden sands 5 (theres at least 10 of them all in the same area and all pretty much the same.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised how good accomodation was”
Reviews.Author: Tina2go
Reviews.Content: Stayed only a couple of nights in April due to being stuck with Ash cloud in Dubai. For £50 per night the accomodation was very good. Very roomy and looked like it had recently been refurbished. Shower room bit old - not to be lingered in! Small kitchen area with washing machine which was great! and a large fridge freezer. Apartments do run a free bus to beach but think it was booked up. Free internet use in lounge area - good for when we could get on it. No hairdryer in room but I lonly had to ask for one and one was delivered to the room. Can walk to small supermarket almost across the road or to a larger spinneys about 10 mins away and to shopping mall and restaurants and metro station if weather reasonable. Although the apartments had two pools they were not very enticing and had very few loungers available. Would recommend if looking for a reasonable priced apartment in the area.

Reviews.Title: “you can't go wrong for the price”
Reviews.Author: battling
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online through their own website , payment upfront of 3 days of our stay . I was very pleasantly surprised when i entered the room on the 7th floor , it was fantastic , I walked out onto the balcony to have a look around , but there isn't much of a view , walked back into the room only to find the door wouldn't lock . then we found out the toilet seat was broken ...we rang reception and they assured us it would be fixed first thing in the morning . when we arrived back to our room after a tour , these things had still not been fixed , so we rang reception again , the apologized for it not being fixed , but they don't allow the maintenance men in the room if your not there ...well that's fair enough i guess , and they were sent straight up there to fix the problems ...done in no time . the room is large , with all kitchen facilities including a combo washer/dryer ..... but the dryer liked to go all night long ! very annoying while your trying to sleep . staff where friendly and helpful . I agree with others that the bathrooms could do with refurbishing , but the rest of the room is lovely . there is a really nice little restaurant just around the corner ,Good reasonably priced food , good service & nice and close it's just past the little supermarket , which is also handy and cheap for the things you need for your room . It isn't the most convenient of locations , not close to the rail system at all , but there are plenty of taxis around . Just be careful when you walk out the door and the doormen ask you if you want a taxi , they aren't doormen , they don't help you with your luggage , they are drivers employed by the sands and while they are friendly and helpful if you hire them , they are much more expensive than a normal taxi ...so if you want a normal taxi , grab one yourself . All in all we had a good stay at the golden sands 3 ...thanks so much for a good stay .

Reviews.Title: “Good value !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DOODLES33
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weeks stay at the Golden Sands apartments no 3 We had a 2 bed 2 bathroom apartment with balcony which was spacious and clean also had a washing machine which was very useful, There is a pool and restaurant on site and a computer in the lobby were you can check emails, they also have a free shuttle bus to the beach. There is a supermarket called Spinneys nearby which sells all you could need and the metro station is about a 10 min wlk next to the Burjumen shopping mall. I would recommend the Apartments to anyone looking for a good value for money base and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: VishalJSalot
Reviews.Content: Have been in Golden Sands hotel appartment for almost one month. Excellent hotel. very clean. good facility with comparitive prices. I have been in 2 room studio appartment including kitchen. Having complimentary breakfast in hotel. gr8 swimming pool. have fitness center also. staff is very good. I found the most comfortable hotel with very attractive prices. I have paid 365AED per day as i was there for almost around 28 days. hotel location is also good. near metro station. Its like heart of the city. its Bur dubai. 100% value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay, good if you just need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: rubi55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Golden Sands 10, room 313 which was a 3 bedroom apartment with kitchen, living and dining room, 3 bathrooms and washing machine/dryer room plus balcony. When we walked in it was surprisingly large, the living room was spacious with a TV and some decent channels with english films and bbc world news channel also with 2 sofas. Dining room table was large - enough for 8 people. The kitchen was well equipped with cutlery and plates/cups etc, fridge freezer a cooker and oven, kettle and microwave. There was a long hallway to get to the bedrooms, there were 2 rooms with 2 single beds each plus 2 bathrooms and one master bedroom with queen size bed at the end of the hallway with an ensuite bathroom. Bedrooms were large and clean with a considerable amount of wardrobe space and a chest of drawers. Bathrooms were OK, could have been abit cleaner but average on the whole. The apartment was cleaned daily but I don't think the bed linen was changed everyday. It was still reasonably clean and we didn't expect an apartment to be serviced anyway. The reception staff were helpful and the bellboys were attentive and friendly. The hotel lobby was nice and there was a pc to check emails etc - although a bit slow. There was also a pool, sauna, gym, squash court and table tennis available. We didn’t eat in the restaurant as we were self-catering but there was a large supermarket called Spinneys across the road from the hotel which we used a lot and was really handy! It had everything we needed there as well as a food deli to buy things like ready cooked pastas, roast chicken, salad, rice, spring rolls, samosas which was good when we wanted to eat in the evening. Through Spinneys there’s also a McDonalds and foreign exchange place that had a good exchange rate. The hotel was in a good location in Bur Dubai and was fairly quick to get to places. Taxis are cheap and frequent outside the hotel. A tip is to use the yellow taxis rather than normal ones as the fare starts off at 3 dhs whereas some others start higher at something like 7 dhs. The BurJuman shopping mall is about 5 minutes walk and is a really nice place to go and the main road has some good food places from Pizza Hut to Indian restaurants and one in particular we enjoyed was called Sukh Sagar - a really tasty vegetarian restaurant. The hotel is really close to Dubai Creek. Also really close to the airport - about 10 - 15minutes taxi ride. Not too far from Jumeirah beach which is so lovely and the big shopping malls – some of which are Dubai Mall which has an excellent aquarium where you can even feed the fish, Deira City Centre, Mall of the Emirates where you can visit Ski Dubai – really good fun – and Ibn Batuta Mall, influenced by other countries in the world like China, Egypt, Tunisia and more. We did the Night bus tour which was 2 hours and takes you round most of Dubai and you can see the main destinations in Dubai. We also visited the Palm Jumeirah which is a must see. We took a train costing just 25 dhs which runs above the island and you can see the famous Atlantis Hotel and great views of the city. Overall our stay at Golden Sands was very pleasant and I would recommend this to people who are looking for an affordable place to stay rather than people looking for something luxurious. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1900al
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 5 after needing to book accomodation due to the Volcanic Ash chaos. We had a superb self contained apartment with a king size bed and a lounge area. The flat screen tv had at least five english channels which was good. The staff cleaned the apartment every day, including washing up. A fridge-freezer, washing machine and microwave was also on hand. A "Spinneys" supermarket was just up the road, as was a shopping centre and the Metro. So travel was not a problem. We payed £44 a night without breakfast - the breakfast is really not worth the extra money. That is my only negative. The gym and the pool were ok. Overall fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KBY53
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive due to reading some of the disparaging reviews, however, we were pleasantly surprised at the comfortable accommodation at Golden Sands 3. Room’s cleaned and fresh bed linen changed every day. Hotel staff were very helpful, professional and courteous. Shower could have been better and internet access was very slow in the lobby area. However, internet and safe were completely free of charge. Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Great value for money. Young Family:London

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE... VALUE FOR MONEY!!”
Reviews.Author: Aspire2TravelThWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Golden Sands 10 for 5 nights and 6 six days in november. The apartments provide with a fully furnished -spacious apartment with almost everything u require for a Self Serving Stay. The staff was friendly and really helpful. U can get all ur eatables nd daily requirements at Spinny,s supermarket just across the street . The building has a common pool, squash court ,a gym and a games room for kids. Also theres a coffee shop at the ground level. i won't lie to u.. i didn't use the pool, nor did i even think of entering the gym or playing squash.. but The apartment provided me with the most essential of all things... An Internet connection in my room and a Wi-Fi at the lobby level. There are many golden sands buildings in the bur dubai area, of which No 10 seems to be the best of them all. All in all a very nice place to stay ....

Reviews.Title: “Deposit Needed!!! Perks are gone”
Reviews.Author: SLM747
Reviews.Content: Three travellers including myself were at the counter arguing when they demanded 300 AED. This was all a surprise. People should be told ahead of this weird policy. However, I did make a fuss about it. Upon my departure, I did received the my money. The airport shuttle service is no longer available, and buses for shopping that they once offered is no longer available as well. Only the bus to the beach at 9;40 am is in service. They are cutting back everywhere. On the bright side of things, my room was very big, and clean with a super king size bed. Golden Sands is centrally located and in walking distance to the metro. They metro has expanded. The metro to the airport to Terminal 1 and 3 is super fast and cheap, BUT there is no connection to terminal 2.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay & Great Value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: richchick3
Reviews.Content: Because our flight arrived in Dubai so very late at night, we had booked an inexpensive hotel for our first night in Dubai. From a practical standpoint, we didn't want to arrive at our planned 'luxury' hotel near midnight just to end up paying a few hundred dollars and checking out the next morning. We were booked at the Golden Sands #3. There are 10 of these Golden Sands Hotels in the area, 3 of which are for short term hotel stays. If you are booking through an agency or online, remember to ask which one you are booked for. Even though they are all within close proximity, you will save a lot of time, energy, and cab fare by knowing from the start which one to go to. Upon arrival we found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. They were also multilingual which we appreciated since we only speak English. We were treated courteously at all times. We found our room to be unusually spacious and very clean. It was 'L' shaped which defined the living and sleeping areas. There was a kitchen area with the usual amenities such as dishes, water, coffee, tea, etc. We ordered late night room service and my finicky teenagers found the food to be very good! There was a washer/dryer. Our balcony overlooked the pool area. Air conditioning kept us comfy. There was wifi in the room as well as a business center near the lobby. The hallways were quiet even though next morning I noted numerous families with young children Our mattresses were firm so we slept well. There was also a sofa bed in the room. Before checking out of the hotel, we took a walk around the neighborhood. There were numerous hotels and apartments in the area as well as a shopping mall with a grocery store. This hotel is not on or near a beach. Your room key will also work the elevator. We appreciated the fact that only guests could take the elevator. By the way, Dubai is on the list of safest places to vacation. This is not a luxury hotel but it is a very basic, safe and comfortable hotel. I do not recommend this hotel if you are looking for high luxury & pampering I do highly recommend this hotel if you want clean, basic comfort & courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of personal items and no response from complaint”
Reviews.Author: DelboyDevonu_k
Reviews.Content: Althoung looking forward to staying in Dubai this hotel ruined it for us.It is Not near the new Metro station. You need to Taxi every where(beware Taxi drivers taking detours) We didnt expect our Lugage to be raided and personal items stolen from our Lugage and room.Even though we did use the safe supplied, as caring for an elderly pensioner didnt expect their and our belongings to be stolen.It was reported to the Hotel but we have had no response. The air vent in our bathroom had years of dust falling out on us.cracked tiles and Long Ladies hair in the shower + bathroom floor. The room although big enough was never properly cleaned .Gave the staff time to check out our belongings i expect. They were renovating rooms on our floor. It would have been good for the hotel to address the issue and complaint. .Golden Sands have many buldings. check which one you are in before you RISK this hotel. There are better Hotels in far better Locations.If i ever return it Wont be to this hotel in Dubai. Good Luck with your search

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel @ Great price”
Reviews.Author: bazzy_1
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at GS5 room 517 for 10 days. The room was clean and had everything we needed. We felt comfortable and enjoyed our stay. When ever we approached the reception desk they were helpful. Our room was cleaned everyday and we have no complaints at all. Definatly recommend this hotel as its value for money considering prices for other hotels. Walking distance from Al Fahidi Street (Meena Bazar). We booked via lastminute.com. Taxis are resonable priced and available all the time. our flight back was in the early ours of the morning and we got a taxi straight away. There is plenty to do in Dubai and we think we were in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in these appartments”
Reviews.Author: ExeterUKMagoo
Reviews.Content: Items went missing from our luggage - hotel did not want to know or respond to emails Bathroom was filthy - air filter was disgusting - ladies hair in bathroom still 3 days after we arrived. Rooms were of a good size and ideal for 3/4 people but would not use this hotel/appartment ever again

Reviews.Title: “Quite handy”
Reviews.Author: ancient_mariner96
Reviews.Content: Not too far from the main places to see and as taxis are available at a very reasonable cost the place is quite handy. My wife and I were disappointed with the menu for dinner but breakfast was fine. For dinner I suggest that you should have a look at the recommendations in Trip Advisor. There are numerous and very good places to eat. Don't be afraid to try the local foods.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: Dennis07
Reviews.Content: There are at least 10 Golden Sands apartment buildings in the area. We stayed in number 5 and shared a restaurant and pool with apartment # 3. The location is great as it is an easy walk to a mall and the new Metro. From the metro you can access many areas of Dubai. The street was quiet and there was a small convenience store across the road where we could buy a few staples. The room was good and comfortable. The housekeeping staff were very helpful. The front desk staff were not so helpful as we always thought we were interupting them. The pools are small for the number of people using them but overall it was okay. The breakfasts were average and a person would tire of them after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience in a logic price”
Reviews.Author: miky64
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Golden Sands 5 in January and I had only positive experience. One little problem I had with my Internet connection and the balcony door has been repaired soon from the kind hotel stuff. The hotel had everything they promise and the stuff was helpful. The hotel is not in the beach so you have to either use the free hotel bus once a day,or take a taxi or walk to Spinneys super market and get the bus. In the other side the beach hotels are 200 % more expensive. They have stopped with free transfer to and from the airport as the used to in the earlier years. The Internett connection was not very fast but it was OK. Please note that there are 10 Golden Sands hotels in the area but only no 3,5 and 10 are let in every day basis. All the other are rented for longer periods,per month etc I absolutely recommend the hotel to anybody except those that want a beach hotel with a lot of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A Very good hotel With a good rate”
Reviews.Author: 007-Tehran
Reviews.Content: I was in golden sands 5 for 5 day & it was a very good hotel .it's very clean & have a very good rate.it's about 10 min walk to metro station(Khalid bin al waleed Station).it's good to know that every time you want to take a taxi it;s better to take a taxi which have a taxi sign becuse it's much cheeper.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: tweetyCairo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Golden Sands 3 for 7 days, then we extended our stay,so we had to move to Golden Sands 5 as the first was fully booked. Both hotels are perfect from all aspects, all facilities available, cleanliness is super, staff very helpful & friendly. I want to thank the hotels'management, the receptionists especially Rafaat in GS3 & Ahmed in GS5.The housekeepers,the bell boys are very decent & polite. Keep up this GREAT JOB !

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation with Central Location”
Reviews.Author: overseasCathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands Hotel Apartments #5, room #724, from January 21-January 27. I was pleasantly surprised at the room. The bed was huge and very comfortable, small balcony, couch & loveseat, HDTV, washer & dryer combo, service for 2, pots and utensils to cook with, toaster, refridgerator, and hot water kettle. The room was serviced everyday by housekeeping. The staff were very friendly and informative. There was one porter, that I did not get his name, but his service was outstanding, he helped me get taxi's, helped carry up my shopping, brought me a hair dryer when I requested one, and the list goes on. I added a day and late check out when I arrived and was assured there was no problem and then on my original check-out date I had to go re-confirm as the hotel was booked up. This was dealt with quickly and efficiently though. The pool at GS5 is on the roof so there are no shade issues. Not much view off of roof or balcony but I did not think this was that important, plenty of places to go to in Dubai to get great views. Location was very good, taxi's were easy to get and they knew where Golden Sands was.Most destinations were between 10 dhms and 50 dhms which is very reasonable. I had no problems using the free internet in the business center, each time I went, and I went daily, I was usually the only one in there. The internet was usually fast and I completed my business in 15 to 20 minutes. I only ate at the restaurant one day and the food was good. I did not go to the fitness center although I probaly should have.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands”
Reviews.Author: ThomasW28
Reviews.Content: A nice apartment hotel with fair prices, rooms with fridge, stow and washing machine. Only - was the restaurant but I ate breakfast in the room and lunch/dinner at other restaurants in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Sands 3 Suprisingly nice and cozy room”
Reviews.Author: Barbara B
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, this chain of hotels actually. In GS 3, the staff were very helpful and acommodating. We arrived there at 6 am and they checked us in after a few minutes of wait. Tthe room (425) is very big and clean, with clean sheets and towels, changed once a day... the kitchen is equipped and there is even a washer/dryer and iron and ironing board in the room. Internet is free in the lobby and the dining hall, you can even print up to 2 pages without charge! There is a cash machine right outside the entrance and the local calls, when made in the lobby is for free! The hotel location is excellent because you can easily walk to nearby stores, to the Museum, and the old souks. The Abra station is very close too, so it is easy to get to Dheira. If ur not for walking, just get a cab..they are cheap and the drivers are very honest and helpful. The Dubai Mall (dont miss this!), Burjuman and WAFI malls are very near. Congratulations GS...your hotel is a home away from home. Will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManiJain
Reviews.Content: Nice apartment hotel and good for a long stay with families, having all kitchen ad drawing room facilities in room. free hotel teasfers. free internet in restaurent.

Reviews.Title: “In Desperate Need Of Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: danceone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Golden Sands 3 over Christmas (be careful in which one you are staying as there are over 12 different blocks all of different ages) and weren't that impressed. Whilst the apartments probably do meet their 3 star rating based on the facilities available and size, certainly Golden Sands 3 is in need of refurbishment if our apartment was anything to go by. Whilst it does have a few bonuses such as your own kitchen complete with washer dryer it equally had some more worrying issues like a very basic bathroom really showing signs of wear and tear and not what I would expect from a modern 3 star. Another more worrying issue is that whilst every one of the apartments, and there are 7 floors of them in each block, there is no sign of any smoke detection in case of an emergency anywhere in the room or corridors. With the combination of cooking facilities and no detection this is surely a recipe for disaster at some point when a tourist isn't careful in the kitchen. Other issues are that the general use PC's for accessing the internet are in permenent use, I only saw two occasions when one of the three PCs was available in 5 days. Equally the advertised bus to the beach was permanently fully booked. The restaurant is very basic and not that impressive and combined with the 'dry' no alcohol policy in the hotel isn't that well used. The pool is small but warm but unfortunately is positioned between the blocks and so the sun is shaded from about 14:30 in December so not much good for sunbathing. On a high note if you want a decent restaurant try the 4 points Sheraton around the corner which equally has a bar (although £5 per pint). Staff were friendly in Golden Sands and helpful and always willing to help by giving directions to different areas of Dubai. Equally we were able to get our room on arrival so can't complain here. Depends what you are after overall as these apartments are cheap and would probably suit a family group, just think through what you are after from your accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault it at all.”
Reviews.Author: AT495
Reviews.Content: This is our second christmas stay in Dubai, also the second stay in Golden sands 3. Can not fault this holiday in any way at all, the staff are friendly and very helpful nothing is to much trouble and in my oppinion their aim is to make your stay as pleasurable as they can. The appartments are well furnished and equipped clean & cool!!! and the complex is well located for our requirements, quiet, close to all the local ameneties and the infastructure is as good as anybody needs so your only a cheep taxi ride or train ride from anywhere. It would not be fair not to make a negative comment, but its hard to think of anything to say that would put this place down, so may be one of the bathrooms could be bigger, and a floor mat supplied in each. Thats it 10 out of 10 Golden sands.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: whatever92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Sands for 1 night while travelling through Dubai and it served our needs perfectly. The hotel is in a good location and the room was very clean and spacious. The hotel was also much cheaper than most of the others I found - less than £50 per night. As we were there for only a short time, we did not have much need to interact with the staff - so can't really comment on that aspect. If you were going to Dubai for a week, you might want somewhere a bit more up-market but for a night or two I thought it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “awful , rude, surly attitude,seedy place”
Reviews.Author: tajandtiger
Reviews.Content: We had booked online for accomodation at Golden sands 10 with confirmation in writing and email. We then informed them that we would arrive two days later instead , due to unforseen delays on our trip from India. We were reassured all is well in writing. So we arrive at 8 pm with three young children only to be told we they had canceled our booking.. The The young man at the recption desk was very incompetent and rude and insisted that we did not have a booking. We showed him our correspondence but this was insufficient in his mind. Finally we phoned the manager from our own mobile phone, as an act of complete desperation as we were going nowhere for over an hour and the kids were getting frenzied. It turned out they they had overbooked and basically had no rooms for us in tower 10. We were then sent Golden Sands 5, and were informed it is even better. The apartment was smelly, dusty, air con spewed smoky air ino the room, which we could not turned off, and the general staff atttude was cold except for the head of housekeping. It turns out that it is a seedy place where prostitutes ply their trade openly. We checked out at 5 am and saw a stream of women leaving the building after night swork ......You definitely dont want to be there with young kids ........It was by far the worst accomodation we stayed in and we had just arrived from rural India. ..... we will not recommmend this place

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for the price”
Reviews.Author: Miyoch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Sands #3 for 3 nights. We booked the room through expedia.com and we paid CAD$72 a night for a suite for 2 people. The room is big (>500 sq feet), clean and in good conidtions. It has a tv, washer and dryer and small kitchen. It has all the basic ammenities for a short stay. The service is also good. The location of #3 is not the greatest. You have to walk 10 minutes to a big greocery store Spinney and a mall. Since most of the apartments look quite similar, it was a bit difficult to find it the first time. Dubai is very big and nothing seems to be within walking distance. You need taxi all the time and it is quite cheap: AED$40 from airport to the hotel (the meter started at AED$20 at the airport) and only AED$23 from hotel to airport. Things are generally quite cheap compared to North American standard. We went to a small local mall nearby and the food was very cheap and very good there. I ordered a Sri-Lanka curry beef meal and it cost AED$14. The meal was so big that I can only finished about 70% of it. An all-you-can-eat lunch buffet eas AED$25. Dubai is very North-American. You really don't realize that you are in middle east. That means we didn't have a chance to taste the real Arabian food. Maybe we didn't kow where to find the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected for this price in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: sdselamat
Reviews.Content: I don't know what other reviewers were expecting for USD113 a night in Dubai, but we were delighted with our king-bed studio in Golden Sands 5. Enormous bed with firm mattress, comfy bedding and 5 pillows, 2 x 2-seater sofa + coffee table + rug, small dining table + 2 chairs, flat screen TV, small balcony, washer/dryer, electric kettle, double hotplate, microwave oven, glassware, cutlery, crockery and cookware, AND a very decent bathroom with bidet and fresh towels. Oh, we also got a free large bottle of mineral water, and a few sachets of coffee/tea/sugar/creamer. Although the staff weren't jumping for joy to be working there, we got what we wanted with minimum fuss (changed from non-smoking to smoking room, breakfast, taxi to airport, etc). The 24-hour minimart next door was conveniently located and had everything we wanted. A must-try is the hot & spicy microwave popcorn - bizarre but seriously addictive. We went back and bought 6 boxes to take home! You can get staff who are happy to indulge your every whim if you're willing to get out of this price range. However, if you're looking for a very decent and comfortable place to stay at a reasonable price in Dubai, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good space and location for a budget accommodation, but staff is pretty much useless”
Reviews.Author: fattsmann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Sands 3 in a 2 room studio (1 bedroom, 1 bed in an L-shaped studio, 2 bathrooms) from November 23rd to 30th. I was able to get in on a deal that cost us <$100 per night for my room. I took a regular Dubai Taxi to get to the Golden Sands 3 with no problems getting to the correct building. Checked in, but had to wait an hour before our room was ready (we arrived before the normal check-in time). The apartment itself was spacious, clean, plenty of closet space. As others have noted, it included a cook-top, microwave, refrigerator, and washer/dryer. They also gave us 1 bottle of water as well as daily coffee (instant, but ok) and tea packets. The housekeeping staff took care of all clean up of utensils and cookware, which was a nice touch, as well as replacing towels and general tidying of the apartment. Internet access at the cafe worked well after I set my wireless modem to be on 802.11g mode only -- if you don't do this, you will get horrendous lag and really slow speeds as it bumps you down to the slower wireless modes. The location is pretty good, being about a 15 minute walk from Bur Juman mall and Spinneys supermarket. This is a pretty grueling walk in the heat though, so during my trip, we left early in the morning and we had a route that would keep us in the shade almost the entire way. Bur Juman mall became our "home base" for getting a sit-down breakfast (usually at Paul's cafe by the entrance of the mall) as well as transportation (taxi stand is at the entrance, also Dubai Metro stop is on the other end of the mall). My only complaint with my stay is that the hotel front desk staff were basically useless. They couldn't recommend any places to eat around the area and they referred me to calling information over the phone or looking at the yellow pages. They paced around the front desk area look for papers to shuffle through to dodge having to deal with hotel guests. That's right, they do an incredible amount of paper shuffling for a hotel in the computer-internet age. Would I recommend this place? Yes, for either a (1) budget accommodation with good bang for the buck or (2) for someone that is not a beach person. Don't expect too much from the front desk staff and do your own homework about where to go, eat, etc. and you will be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, and cheap for Dubai - but avoid the hotel car”
Reviews.Author: Kauai2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 3 (make sure you know which Golden Sands you are in as there are like 12 different Golden Sands Hotel in the area). From the research we did, we found that this was the cheapest hotel we could find in the expensive city of Dubai. We paid about $175 USD for a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom. It was quite spacious - there was a kitchen (complete with W/D) area and a living room area with sofas and a dining table. There were 2 single beds in the corner by one bathroom and then there was a seperate bedroom with a double bed that also had its own bathroom. So technically, there was only 1 true bedroom and the other 2 beds were more like in the open area (no door separating this area from the living room/kitchen). Postives: it was clean, spacious, came with a free bottle of water (we were informed not to drink the tap water), and also had free internet in the lobby. Negatives: mattress was pretty hard. We also had a negative experience with the hotel car. We went to check out and stepped outside to hail a cab to the airport and the hotel car driver came running up to us and assured us that he was using the meter and quoted us a reasonable price to the airport, which we agreed to. As soon as we got in, we noticed that the base fare for the meter was a bit higher than what we had seen in normal city taxis. When we arrived at the airport, the driver asked for more money than we had originally agreed to because he said he had to pay tolls (regular taxis are exempt from tolls, but he stated that as he was the hotel car, he was not exempt). We informed him that he did not mention tolls when we were agreeing on a price and we sat there for about 5 minutes arguing an he finally agreed to just let us pay what was on the meter. I'm fairly sure that it still would have been cheaper if we just would have taken a normal city taxi, so we would recommend AVOIDING the hotel car, no matter how persistent they are.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: IrisMB
Reviews.Content: There are a number of blocks in this complex. We were in block 5. It's a 15 minute walk to Bastakiya and 5 minutes to the closest (operating) metro (Burjuman). We had a very comfortable king size bed. It was quiet and we slept brilliantly. The room was serviced every day. The hotel is a bit down at heel, but this represents great value nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and chearful”
Reviews.Author: scmmfa
Reviews.Content: * Staff there are extremely miserable. * You can only use the internet in the restaurant. * Restaurant morning buffet is quite expensive considering the limited range on offer. * Do not expect any tea/ coffe sachet to be left daily, you only get 2 tea bags for the entire stay ! * Rooms are quite spacious, but dirty towels in bathroom, I doubt they are washed everyday. * Basically, if you are not too fussed about receiving a reasonble good 'service', then it's ok for the price, otherwise look elsewhere. The hotel has some sort of deal with an expensive taxi company, so do not use them. If you stand outside the hotel, you will find a beige colour cheap taxi within a few minutes. 10 minute walk will take you to a local supermarket and burger king etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great vlue for money”
Reviews.Author: JAYELL3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GS3. The room was great, with a fridge/freezer and hot plate (no oven). It was cleaned every day to a good standard. It is in the city area so a good distances from the beach area but we knew that before we went. Taxis are quite cheap so not to bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, miserable welcome....”
Reviews.Author: Siinq8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands 5 for 3 nights and it was okay - nothing more and nothing less. The room was okay - a studio with quite nice furniture, twin beds, kitchenette, etc. The advert said the room could accommodate up to three but they clearly did not encourage this as despite the fact we told them there would be three of us when we booked, there was no bed linen in the room to make up the sofa bed and there was only two of everything else such as towels, crockery, cutlery, etc. which was a bit odd. We requested extra bed linen for the sofa bed and the housekeeper promptly brought some to us including extra towels. However, when the room was made up the next day the third towel disappeared again!! The furnishings in the room were quite nice although the mattress on the sofa bed had some revolting looking stains on it so in the end my son slept on it closed. Staff wise, the receptionists were rather odd - far from welcoming. My biggest dislike was most times when I went to the counter I virtually always had to ask for service, despite the fact that the receptionists saw me waiting right in front of them! In fact, one morning I said 'good morning' cheerily to the guy on reception and he did not even acknowledge me until I repeated it in a more aggressive tone. The staff in the breakfast room were a bit more pleasant, but top marks go to the back of house staff such as the housekeepers who were always really courteous and greeted is with big smiles. The breakfast was included in our room rate, but again only for two of us so we had to pay for my nine year old son. The food was mediocre but plentiful enough although to be honest I would have preferred to not have had the breakfast in the room rate and made do with the kitchenette in the room to rustle something up instead. The complex has two swimming pools - both small but enough to keep kids and some adults amused for a while. There was also a gym and sauna although we never got to use them. The breakfast room was located in the coffee shop which did food throughout the day although we did not try it. For internet, we had to borrow a cable from the reception to use our computer in the room although it didn't seem to work and according to the instructions they provided it would not have been particularly fast anyway. They also had free wifi in the coffee shop and whilst we never used it, several other people were on it regularly so presumably it was okay. Our room rate gave us a late checkout of 4pm. The night before, reception has left us a note saying we had to be out before that but when it was queried with them they agreed it was a mistake and checkout was indeed 4pm. That was very useful as our flight was not until quite late in the evening and it meant we could rest a bit in the afternoon before travelling. Baggage can be left at the hotel once you have checked out but it is just left out in the lobby by the toilets and they ask you to sign a responsibility waiver so I would not recommend leaving any valuables in your luggage. Saying that, we had no problems. The hotel location is okay - a 15 minute walk from Bur Juman and it's new metro station and there's loads of restaurants in the surrounding hotels too. There's always loads of taxis passing by so they are easy enough to flag down, although coming back was sometimes difficult as some taxi drivers never knew exactly where the complex was - quite understandable given that there are many in the Golden Sands chain. In fact, make sure you get dropped at the right one as some of the others are quite a walk away and the whole area looks identical no matter which street you are on. All in all our stay at Golden Sands 5 was okay, but to be honest I think there are better apartment complexes around the same areas for similar money. My biggest issue with the place was with the reception staff, many of whom could do with a bit of customer service training or better still, laughing gas!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: FrankS6
Reviews.Content: It was cramped, dirty, smelly and musty. Not really a place I'd go again to. Helpful staff, a pool and a small cafe in it gave it a poor insted of a terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Super value, super hotel”
Reviews.Author: curlsDartford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Sands #3. On arrival noted ATM machine in lobby. Large, spacious reception with plenty of seating and 3 computers with Internet. We arrived at the hotel at 8am and were allowed access to our studio immediately, which to me was a big plus compared to the European counterparts. Clean, quick bright lift (beware fast closing doors) took us to our accommodation. Wow, when entered room, icy cool, big and well equipped. (Air conditioning that we could control.) For the price very impressed. Desk, dining and occasional tables, 2, two seater sofas, TV, huge fridge freezer, microwave, two burner cooker, washing machine, sink, iron, iron board and a KETTLE. Huge windows and balcony, with insect netting. Lovely bathroom and comfy beds, linen for which was changed frequently. Another big plus, free, easy to operate, in room safe. We also discovered there was a daily courtesy bus to the beach. When we finally went exploring, we found the hotel was well located for supermarkets, eateries and shopping malls, buses and the metro (some stations still under construction). Dubai is really hot and the heat wraps itself around you like an electric blanket, so if you are going somewhere specific, jump in a taxi, air conditioned, inexpensive and plentiful around the hotel. Having said that, the hotel is in a very quiet location. We didn't visit Dubai to spend all day in a hotel, but if we did, then Golden Sands 3, would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with number ten”
Reviews.Author: Brainspin
Reviews.Content: There are several Golden Sands Hotel Apartments in the same neighbourhood. Golden Sands 10 generally seems to get highest acclaim, and we stayed here in June 2009. We had two big apartments, one with two and one with three bedrooms. The bathrooms were nice, the kitchens big and everything was clean. Furniture was a little worn and there was very little equipment in the kitchens, but on the other hand the price was very low. We experienced good, if not great service, and are generally very satisfied with our stay. Be warned, however, that it is not possible to be outdoors in Dubai in June. Even the 300 meters to Bur Juman shopping center was exhausting and very little happens around Golden Sands. You are only minutes away from the action, however, with incredibly cheap taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jobfamily
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious apartments, easy reach of the Bur Juman Mall and local supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable... stay here if you do not require first-class lodging”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMedic
Reviews.Content: I can say that the Golden Sands Hotel Apartments are acceptable. If you do not need first-rate hotels, then this is a place you can consider. It had a decent bathroom, comfortable bed and couch, little kitchen and would be okay for an extended-stay place if you needed it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect group accomodation”
